• Beautifully created, colorful and rich 3D environments - from snow-capped mountains to a land of hot active volcanoes
• Simple, easy to learn interface
• Intuitive, mouse-based controls (with additional keyboard control for advanced players)
• Built with Touchdown Entertainment's Jupiter 3D engine

Source: The Developer Website.

NOTE: This game was re-released under the name of: Realms of Illusion. Nothing about the game was changed except for the title.

168730.name: Book of the Deceived
168730.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is not because they are extinct that the Restless Stars are lost to us.

They are lost to us because they were deceived.

— Antu-Herap, the Prince of Glass

This book includes:

The inscrutable history, motives, and inner workings of the so-called Lost Guild of mummies. Enemies to most and a mystery to all, theirs is a multi-millennial legacy of treachery, madness, and revenge.
Complete rules and systems for running the Akhem-Urtu, lost Irem’s guild of Restless Stars, including step-by-step player character creation — for those who dare step inside the minds of the Deceived.
“The Trail of Heresy” — a complete Mummy story that Storytellers can run alone or as the second act in a three-part series called The Avarice Chronicle.

168731.name: Aura 2: The Sacred Rings
168731.description:
Prepare yourself for an extraordinary journey like never before as you encounter the World of The Sacred Rings. This first-person point-and-click adventure is the sequel to Aura: Fate of the Ages.

Play as Umang as you awake and find yourself alone in a strange, dark and unwelcoming world. Clenched in your fist lies a series of rings – the Sacred Rings that grant the holder unlimited power and immortality. Quickly you realize that a rival clan has tracked you down and that they want the Sacred Rings’ power for their own evil purposes. You must protect the Sacred Rings and return them to the Keepers ... the only ones who will be able to watch over them.

Source: The Developer Website.

168732.name: Escape the Museum
168732.description:
It’s a warm day in the city and Susan Anderson has brought her daughter Caitlin to work for the day at the National Museum of History. What began as an exciting day for Caitlin and Susan ends in devastating suspense when, just after closing, a 7.6 magnitude earthquake rocks the city. After getting Caitlin to safety Susan scours the museum for anyone left behind but is knocked unconscious by falling debris. When Susan awakes she finds the museum left in shambles. Barely able to move from room to room you must help Susan navigate and work her way through the maze of the museum in a series of puzzles and frantic searching. Can you help Susan get back to Caitlin and escape the museum together?

Source: The Developer Website.

168733.name: Escape the Museum 2
168733.description:
Help David reach his wife and daughter, who became trapped in the museum across town, after a devastating earthquake rocks the city. Navigate the treacherous streets, risk life and limb at every step, figure out the best possible path with the help of an unlikely stranger. David must reach his family before nightfall, can you help him?

Source: The Developer Website.

168734.name: Adventure Chronicles: The Search for Lost Treasures
168734.description:
After narrowly saving and escaping an earthquake struck Museum with her daughter, Susan Anderson is presented with an extremely rare opportunity. One to travel the world, to explore never before seen landscapes, to find some of the greatest unsolved treasure of our time. Follow Susan as she explores, solves, and unearths these centuries old well hidden masterpieces lost in history.

Source: The Developer Website.

168735.name: Enlightenus
168735.description:
A reclusive author has asked for your help! Travel to the mysterious world of Enlightenus and use your detective skills to track down Edgar Lee's missing novels. Explore an entirely different maze full of perplexing puzzles and intricate locks, as you collect each chapter of the missing books. This unique Hidden Object Adventure game challenges you to solve each riddle in order to escape the land of Enlightenus!

Source: Big Fish Games.

168736.name: Enlightenus II: The Timeless Tower
168736.description:
Clarence Flatt, an expert clockmaker, has asked for your help and has offered you the chance to explore the legendary Timeless Tower! While working on the incredible Ageless Clock, something goes wrong and pieces of the device end up all over the Timeless Tower. These pieces begin to unravel the very fabric of time, and only you can set things right in Enlightenus II: The Timeless Tower, a fun Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game.

Source: Big Fish Games.

168737.name: Go-Rilla
168737.description:
A part of Milton Bradley's "T.H.I.N.G.S." series, players try to roll barrels across the bridge while Go-Rilla raises and lowers it.

From the box:
Can your roll the barrels to safety before time runs out?

Push the explorer's button. A barrel will roll out of his backpack and onto the rocking, rattling bridge.

Keep pushing the button to roll out the barrels. Will they roll safely into the cabin - or get knocked off the bridge?

When the timer stops Go-Rilla pops the bridge open! How many barrels made it into the cabin?

168738.name: Dr. Wack-O
168738.description:
A wind-up dexterity game, part of Milton Bradley's "T.H.I.N.G.S." series of games. Try to flip over all of the discs and capture them with the magnetic hammer.

From the box:
Can you flip the lids before time runs out?

Start the timer by moving the mouse counterclockwise as far as it will go. The platform will start turning.

As lids pass in front of Dr. Wack-O press the button to flip the lips label-side down.

As the flipped over lids pass in front of the hammer, whack them to flip them into the slot!

Whack out all the flipped lids before the timer stops - or Dr. Wack-O will flip right out of his lab!

168739.name: Jack B. Timber
168739.description:
A dexterity game from Milton Bradley's "T.H.I.N.G.S." line of games. Knock all of the wood slices from the rotating tree before the timer runs out.

From the box:

Can you chop down the stump before time runs out?

Fit stump into base, then stack stump pieces onto buzzard post, facing target pegs in any direction.

Fit post into stump hole and you're ready for action!

Move switch on to start the stump turning.

Pull back on axe trigger and then let go! Aim Jack's axe at the peg to whack a piece off the stump.

Chop down all five pieces before time runs out or the stump will jump and the buzzard will buzz off.

168740.name: 8 Kingdoms
168740.description:
8 Kingdoms, a fantastic collection of card games for 2-8 players, features characters and artwork from the world of Royal Strawberries and Imperial Harvest. Includes:

Kingdom Quest
2-8 players
30 minutes
Ages 12 and up

Summary: Players start with an Emperor (representing themselves and their realm) and are given a hand of cards from which they must draft/recruit new champions to their Kingdom. Points are obtained through a combination of melding sets (identical champions from multiple realms), runs (a string of champions from the same realm), collecting Kingdom Cards (champions from your own realm), and completing specialty Quests.


Control & Chaos
3-8 Players
45-90 minutes
Ages 12 & up

Summary: A 3-suited, trick-taking card game where players earn points for successfully completing their bids. After 5 hands, the game ends and the player with the most points wins! Can you maintain Control or will the four Chaos Cards disrupt your play?


Scourge
2-6 Players
45 minutes (full game); 15 minutes per round
Ages 8 and up

Summary: Players start with an identical hand of cards (their kingdom's champions) and simultaneously bid on cards revealed from the Scourge Deck. High cards win treasure cards, low cards win scourges (which have special abilities), and all ties cancel out. When all cards have been claimed, the round ends and players tally up their scores from accumulated treasures and scourges. The first player with the most points after 5 rounds is the winner.


Redemption
3-8 players
20 minutes
Ages 8 and up

Summary: Players take turns guessing how many cards of each suit are held by all players. When another player believes someone has guessed too high, that player may challenge the acting player. When a challenge is made, the loser must continue playing with one of his cards facing toward his adversaries. New hands are drawn with successively less cards dealt out each round. The last player to still hold cards is the winner.

168741.name: Vector
168741.description:
YOU’VE BROKEN FREE, NOW RUN!

Vector is an exciting arcade-style game featuring you as the exceptional free runner who won't be held down by the system. Run, jump and climb using techniques based on the urban-ninja sport of parkour with "Big Brother" in hot pursuit!

Source: The Game Website.

168742.description:
Goblin Hunters is a fast paced push-your-luck style card game combined with set collection and a betting mechanic for 2 to 4 players and is played within 10 to 15 minutes. Goblin Hunters comes with multiple character cards to choose from, each character comes with their own special ability, which can be used once per turn when they go hunting to give you an added advantage.

The Search deck contains 3 types of cards: Goblin Cards, Wound Cards and Goblin/Wound Cards. Try to collect as many goblins as possible without taking too many wounds. While also trying to collect sets of goblins to gain extra bonuses.

This is not the only way to score bonus points, you can bet on the results of the other adventurers, risking your hard earned goblins points for more bonus goblin points. It's a high risk with a high rewards. So the next time your in the tavern healing from your wounds and mouthing off about who the best Goblin Hunter is, make sure you can put your money were your mouth is and bet on your fellow adventurers.

The goal, to be the best Goblin Hunter in the land by capturing 20 goblins first.
168742.name: Goblin Hunters

168743.name: Dragon's Path
168743.description:
English version of the SárkánySakk board game (hungarian).


For all ages with simple rules to be learned easily, and still lots of possible strategies for elder gamers to develop.
3D gameplay experience.
Uncountable board variations.
Balanced gameplay, you always have the chance to overcome your opponents playing with any dragon.
Gameplay length is adjustable to your demand by setting the winning goal to the right value


The heart of the game is moving your dragon on to an orthogonally adjacent cube. When you move from one cube to another, you rotate the cube you are leaving, rotating it in the direction you are moving. If you rotate the cube you just left to the neutral color or your dragon’s color, you get to move your dragon again. In this way, the mottled board slowly becomes green when the green dragon moves, then becomes red when the red dragon moves. The goal of the game is to be the first dragon to score 100 points. Points are scored when you are done moving for your turn. Each cube with your color face up at the end of your turn counts as a point, whether you landed on it this turn or not.

168744.name: Runicards: Dungeons – Os desafios do Deserto
168744.description:
Runicards: Dungeons - Os desafios do Deserto (RDDD) is a board game of action, strategy and adventure that takes place in the same universe cardgame "Runicards: Batalha pela Terra do Fogo" (RBTF). New players do not need the original game to play, but veteran players will feel at ease with this new game.

This is a cooperative game, initially for 1-4 participants. This means that you and your friends are not trying to defeat one another, but will together meet the challenges of the board and try to win in each match group. Each player chooses a hero and every monster defeated and disarmed trap all earn points that can be used to enhance the powers of their characters. Also, you can find treasures to equip your hero with armor, weapons and magic accessories.

168745.name: As If It Could Get Any Better
168745.description:
From publisher blurb:

In spite of constant assaults, the flag of the Arman Protectorate still flies over Trovaska. More clouds are gathering over the city. This time the danger comes from within.

An adventure written for APLs 3, 5 and 7 (character levels 3-8).

168746.name: Warhammer Townscape: Card Buildings for Warhammer games
168746.description:
user summary

Warhammer Townscape is a collection of 39 card houses, inns, towers, ruins, outhouses and much more. Printed in full colour, the buildings are quick and easy to assemble - the ideal backdrop for wargames and roleplayng games. All the Townscape buildings are compatible with Warhammer Fantasy Battle, Warhammer 40,000 and Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay.

168747.name: Secession
168747.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tensions have been mounting between the Arman Protectorate and the Imperial Alliance. The Tsarina openly disrespects the Alliance as senatorial requests are openly ignored. Many Sametian exiles have crossed the Abaddon River to rebuild their homes. One man fights alone to ensure the safety of his homeland and the integrity of the Alliance. Only one question left: What side are you on?

An adventure written for APLs 3, 5 and 7 (character levels 3-8).

168748.name: Dousing Fire With Blood
168748.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Reis Confederacy is a turbulent place, where might makes right. When a whole city disappears, leaving behind a shimmering dome of energy, the Imperatrix must act.

An adventure written for APLs 3, 5 and 7 (character levels 3-8).

168749.name: Binary & Indar (G-Core)
168749.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adversaries is a series of short supplements featuring new villains to use in your campaigns.

Binary & Indar:

A mutant who has the ability to communicate and hack into computers & machines and her partner, a Gorilla who was genetically engineered to be a super soldier. Together, they wage a war against corporations who harm the environment and experiment on innocent animals. Considered terrorists, they will stop at nothing to protect the environment!

168750.name: Binary & Indar (Supers!)
168750.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adversaries is a series of short supplements featuring new villains to use in your campaigns.

Binary & Indar:

A mutant who has the ability to communicate and hack into computers & machines and her partner, a Gorilla who was genetically engineered to be a super soldier. Together, they wage a war against corporations who harm the environment and experiment on innocent animals. Considered terrorists, they will stop at nothing to protect the environment!

168751.name: Starspun Hollow
168751.description:
From publisher blurb:

Floating on the edge of a wooded fen, Starspun Hollow is a font of life and beauty in an otherwise dreary swamp. Equal parts human and halfling and always vibrant with colours, this prosperous village seems to have fallen from a child’s story. Merchants travel from distant lands to purchase the village’s beautiful dyes and unique “star silk,” woven from the webs of the local starweaver spiders. Beneath its pleasant facade, however, Starspun Hollow grapples with political strife concerning its natural resources, made worse by racial tensions older than the village itself.

168752.description: BANG!: Heroes of the Storm pits heroes and villains from World of Warcraft, Diablo and StarCraft against one another in a cross-universe battle for supremacy. BANG!: Heroes of the Storm is based on the world's best-selling shoot 'em up card game BANG!, as seen through the worlds of Heroes of the Storm.
168752.name: BANG!: Heroes of the Storm

168753.name: Mind: Path to Thalamus
videogamehonor: 2015 AzPlay Awards Best Game Design Nominee
2015 AzPlay Awards Best Music/Sound Nominee
2015 AzPlay Awards Most Original Game Idea Nominee
2015 AzPlay Awards Most Re-Playable Game Nominee
2016 Emotional Games Best Artistic Game Nominee
2016 Emotional Games Best Vr Game Nominee
168753.description:
MIND: A Path to Thalamus is a First Person Puzzler that throws you into a fantastic and surreal environment. You will bend the natural elements to your will in order to progress in this emotive, mindbending tale.

This new First Person Puzzler throws the player into a fantastical and surreal environment that allows them to bend the natural elements to their will. I am Carlos Coronado, the man behind “Warcelona”, one of the most renowned campaigns for Left 4 Dead 2, with more than 1,000,000 combined downloads and a 96/100 rating at L4DMaps.

The main developer is Carlos Coronado, the man behind Warcelona, one of the most renowned campaigns for Left 4 Dead 2, with more than 1,000,000 combined downloads, 96/100 rating at L4DMaps and made official campaign by Valve some time ago. This project was co-developed by artist Dani Navarro and scriptwriter Luka Nieto. Additional programming was performed by Jose Ladislao. Many other kind people also supported the project.

Wrapped in a mindbending tale, the gameplay of “MIND” focuses on changing the very weather in order to solve puzzles: the player will cycle between day and night, modify the levels of fog and rain and even travel in time between seasons, changing the environment to advance the gameplay-driven story —indeed, the mechanics are directly related to who the protagonist is, what has happened to him and everything he is doing: a man trapped in his own mind, he must use all the tools at his disposition to escape to reality. Accompannied by the snarky yet heartfelt narration of this comatose patient, the player will guide him through fantastical forests, dark caverns and deceptive worlds of water and ice that directly relate to his emotional state at each point in his journey.

Source: The Developer Website.

168754.description:
Greywood Publishing have teamed up with Gary Chalk, the original artist for the first 8 Lone Wolf books, to bring you Lone Wolf: The Battle for Magnamund.

You are Lone Wolf, the last of the Kai Lords. Or perhaps you are Prince Pelathar, heir to the throne of Sommerlund. Or maybe you are the infamous Giak warrior Kootak, sent by the Darklords to raze the land. Now you can be all of these... in a hand-painted (by Gary) tabletop wargame.

Battle for Magnamund is a fantasy wargame for two or more players. Each battle pits good against evil, and players may control either an entire army or a single brigade on one side at a time. The goal is to allow you to re-create any battle or scenario from the classic Lone Wolf books, and the game comes with pre-made scenarios to start you on your way.

The core game set consists of flat cardboard figures (3 mm thick and die-cut) in a plastic base, played on card maps that are grid-based and modular. The maps are the same material as in Cry Havoc, a previous (and popular) game of Gary's. In addition to being fun, Battle for Magnamund is a showcase for Gary Chalk's inimitable 2-D artwork: all components are illustrated by hand.
168754.name: Lone Wolf: The Battle for Magnamund

168755.name: Who Tooted?
168755.description: Players sit around an electronic sound machine in the shape of a man, controlled by one of the players. One of the players secretly controls the machine, which makes sounds of passing gas. Players bet on who is controlling the machine, and the winner advances along a scoring track.

168756.name: Calmar Class Privateer
168756.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The ship introduced in this installment of the series is the heavily armed 400 dT Calmar Class Privateer.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

rpgitemversion: Cthulhu Live 3rd Edition Companion CD-ROM version
Cthulhu Live 3rd Edition Companion Suite ZIPped version
168757.name: Cthulhu Live 3rd Edition Companion
168757.description:
From publisher blurb:

The stars are right for the eagerly anticipated release of the Cthulhu Live 3rd Edition Companion Suite! This collection of computer applications and support materials was created specifically for the thoroughly revised, expanded, and improved 3rd Edition of the Cthulhu Live live-action role-playing game (LARP).

Skirmisher partnered with Mantra Design Studio to produce this collection of resources (which were originally released as a Companion CD-ROM). With a stunning graphic interface and a soundtrack by Midnight Syndicate, this is a fantastic tool resource for Keepers and Players alike that is compatible with PC, Mac, and Linux platforms.

This suite of resources includes:

Advanced character creation program.
Character Card Creator.
Government ID Badge Creator.
Library of Cthulhu Live game scripts with ready-to-print handouts.
Fearsome collection of “Tome Texts” to print and bind for your own props.
Extensive selection of document props ready to be customized and used in your games.
A simulated secure email server ready to send encrypted email to modern agents.
And much more!

168758.name: House of Pain
168758.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the New World Order.

It’s the autumn of 1991, and the world isn’t what it used to be. Saddam Hussein’s army lies in smoldering ruins. The Soviet Union is suffering its death throes. Germany has been reunified. Africa is aflame with small bush wars. Across the world, the balance of power is shifting. Old powers are dying out and the playing field of the future will be a chaos of warlords and rogue states.

In this full-length adventure for Cthulhu Live 3rd Edition, the players are power-brokers who have been invited to a private summit to help form the geopolitical landscape of the next century. But while they plot their moves and hide their secrets, they may find that they themselves are pawns in a much larger, more ancient game.

This adventure includes:

Suggestions for props, costumes, and atmospheric effects.
World-spanning conspiracies.
42 Pre-generated characters, each packing hidden agendas and deadly secrets
Two versions of the adventure: one optimized for reading on-screen, and one optimized for printing.

168759.name: Relic Knights: Battle Deck
168759.description:
Esper energy flows throughout the universe, binding it and permeating all things. The mighty champions of the Darkspace Calamity channel esper to fuel their actions and unleash devastating attacks.

The Relic Knights: Battle Deck contains everything you need to power your games of Relic Knights!

168760.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Adventures In Turtleopolis Game
boardgameimplementation: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Adventures Under Turtleopolis
168760.description:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Adventures In Turtleopolis, is graphically based on the late 80's cartoon that originated from the comic book by Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird.

2 to 4 players play as one of the four Turtles competing around the board while trying to avoid traps and bad luck spaces. The object of the game is to reach the end of each game board, which supposedly represent a different mission:

Game 1: Race for the Blimp
Game 2: Fight for the Sky
Game 3: Battle for Cereal Castle
Game 4: Dash for Home

These four boards came on the back of the Ralston Cereal Boxes and as such are in conjunction a very simplistic version of similar games like "Snakes and Ladders". Just throw the dice and let luck decide in which space you´ll end up. Some spaces have rewards while others punishments.

There was another Ralston´s TMNT cereal box board game called "Adventures Under Turtleopolis" that came out during the same time, that featured amazing art with TMNT thematic enemies and elements such as the Technodrome and sewers.

168761.description: Play your games of Relic Knights in comfort and style! A premium fabric top prevents damage to cards during game play. Rubber backing lets the dashboard lay flat and prevents the mat from shifting during use.
168761.name: Relic Knights: Elite Dashboard

168762.name: The Green Fairy
168762.description:
From publisher blurb:

Paris at the end of the 19th century: a city of lights, music, excitement at the approach of the new century and aflame with the creative spirit of the Bohemian revolution. But for months the city has been locked in a state of fear as the brutal murderer known as the Raptor stalks the steep streets and narrow alleyways of the north-end hill neighborhood of Montmartre. Many refuse to leave their homes by night. Others frequent establishments such as “The Green Fairy,” an absinthe bar and popular meeting place for artists, actors, whores, criminals, and the well-to-do seeking to taste the thrills and pleasures of Montmartre. This evening, the patrons of “The Green Fairy” will be joined by a visitor beyond their darkest nightmares. The Green Fairy is a game script for Cthulhu Live 3rd Edition. The text contains the game overview and timeline, staging and prop guidelines, and detailed character sheets and backgrounds for 30 player characters! Ideal as an event for a Live Action Role-Playing (LARP) party with friends or as a convention event, it offers hours of fun, intrigue, and horror. This scenario requires the Cthulhu Live 3rd Edition game rules.

This download includes three different variants of the game script — color, black-and-white, and background-free — and each of these comes in low-resolution screen-friendly and high-resolution printer-friendly versions.

168768.name: Sight Unseen
168768.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can we trust our senses? How do we know that what we see is real? Are our eyes inherently deceptive and prone to misdirection? If so, then such flawed organs must be removed, for only in blindness can one perceive the truth: that all the world is horror.
Sight Unseen is a LARP experience like no other. When an assortment of Arkham citizens check into the local hospital for surgery, they find themselves blinded by a madman and forced to confront the unearthly terror he has unleashed upon the world. Sight Unseen is a game script for Cthulhu Live 3rd Edition and requires the Cthulhu Live 3rd Edition game rules. The text contains the game overview and timeline; detailed guidelines for simulating blindness in LARP, including safety precautions; prop, special effects, and stagecraft techniques designed to play upon your player’s senses of touch, smell, taste, and hearing; and detailed character sheets and backgrounds for seven player characters. Ideal as an event for a Live Action Role-Playing (LARP) party with friends or as a convention event, it offers hours of fun, intrigue, and horror.

This download includes three different variants of the game script — color, black-and-white, and background-free — and each of these comes in low-resolution screen-friendly and high-resolution printer-friendly versions.

168769.name: WitchFinder
168769.description:
From publisher blurb:

Set in Yugoslavia in 1943, during the height of World War II, this tense and exciting scenario focuses on the struggle between Allied and Axis special operations teams to seize control of information critical to control of the Balkans. Players can assume roles as military or civilian operatives in one of four opposing factions, the Office of Strategic Services (OSS), the SS Ahnenerbe occult operations division, the Communist partisans, or the Chetnik royalist freedom fighters.

Little by little, however, the characters will begin to realize that their war is not the first to have left its mark on the region in which they are battling for supremacy - and that their actions are uncovering a powerful and dangerous evil that is beyond anything they ever expected to face.

WitchFinder is a Cthulhu Live 3rd Edition script set in the Balkans during World War II that includes introduction, timeline, prop, and costume information and character stats and bios for 30 characters. This electronic script comes with three different variants - color, black-and-white, and background-free - and each of these comes in low-resolution screen-friendly and high-resolution printer-friendly versions.

Although designed for the Cthulhu Live 3rd Edition horror live-action role-playing game, WitchFinder can easily be adapted for use with almost any other horror or action RPG.

boardgameintegration: Epic PvP: Magic
Epic PvP: Magic
168770.description:
Epic PVP: Fantasy is a head-to-head battling card game. At the start of the game, each player chooses a class deck and a race deck, then shuffles them together to create unique character combinations, such as a Human Paladin or Goblin Druid. Each combination creates unique tactics and strategies to use when you battle.

The goal of the game is to defeat your opponent by reducing them to zero life. Players do this by playing moves that act as both attacks and blocks as well as with special cards and abilities granted by the player's choice of class and race.

During a turn, a player adds cards to their "aggression pile", then chooses how many cards to draw from their aggression pile into their hand. The player uses the aggression provided by the cards that remain in their aggression pile to play move cards to block incoming enemy attacks. If an attack isn't blocked, the player takes damage, specifically one damage per unblocked enemy attack. Then all the moves played by that player become attacks for the opponent to deal with on the opponent's next turn. There's more to it than that, but those are the basics...
168770.name: Epic PVP: Fantasy

168771.name: Gemcutter
168771.description:
You are a gemcutter, a master shaper and collector of rare and beautiful gemstones. You are constantly supplied with gems of all kinds from amber to diamonds. You compete with other gemcutters to amass the most valuable collection of gems.

Each player starts the game with a single random gem and the communal Market starts with three random gems. On a player's turn, he or she draws a random gem from the bag and adds it to his or her store. Then, he or she may add one of his or her gems to the Market to gain extra actions equal to the gem's value. The gems are valued 1-5, in order from least to greatest: amber, jet, emerald, ruby, and diamond. Then, that player takes 1 action (in addition any extra actions gained) in which he or she may: trade a gem with the Market, shape a gem, or add another gem to the Market.

When a player trades in a gem, he or she may take other gems from the Market less than or equal to the traded gem's value plus one. For example, if a ruby (value 4) is traded in, it is worth 5 and may be used to trade for a diamond (value 5), an emerald (value 3) and jet (value 2), and many other combinations based on what is available in the Market.

When a player shapes a gem, he or she places it on any of the three appropriate Shaping Tracks on the player aid. A gem may be Polished, then given a Fancy cut, then a Brilliant cut. A gem cannot be given a Fancy cut until it has been Polished and cannot be given a Brilliant cut until it has been given a Fancy cut. Polished gems are worth twice as many points at the end of the game. Fancy cut gems are worth triple and Brilliant cut gems are worth quadruple their values. However, it takes a number of turns equal to its value to be shaped. For example, an emerald (value 3) takes 3 turns to make an uncut gem into a Polished gem. Therefore, the more the points, the longer it takes to shape it.

When the last gem is taken from the bag, the current player finishes his or her turn and then the game proceeds to scoring. The player with the most points wins the game.

168772.name: The Secret Legacy: A Kate Brooks Adventure
168772.description:
Explore Egypt and discover The Secret Legacy of Kate Brooks’ grandmother in this exciting Hidden Object Adventure game! After being given the grim task of cleaning out her deceased grandmother’s office, Kate discovers a letter that describes an entire Secret Legacy! Travel across the globe and uncover a buried treasure! Collect the clues to the mystery behind Kate’s grandmother’s death and save the day!

• Explore 30+ beautiful and detailed environments
• Virtual 3D adds a new dimension
• Incredible atmosphere
• Complete puzzles and mini games
• Rich and deep storyline
• Discover The Secret Legacy!

Source: The Developer Website.

168773.name: Office Shark Tank: Don't Get Eaten Alive!
168773.description:
Office work is bad enough but with the addition of office sharks, it's deadly! Start your day at the 9 a.m. starting space and try to avoid being eaten alive by the mechanized hungry office shark. Flick the spinner and depending on what it stops on, you either advance or retreat. After moving, if you land on one of the "blood spots", it's feeding time! Wind the shark up, set him on the playing board and let him rip! After 3 bites, you're out of the game. If you make it to the end of the day at the 5p.m. finish line, you've made it out of the office alive!

A fun little mini board game to play in the office or at home!

168774.name: Sandra Fleming Chronicles: Crystal Skulls
168774.description:
The legendary Crystal Skulls have been lost for centuries. Sandra Fleming is hired to find them for Professor Harold Wagner. Will Sandra be able to retrieve the skulls from a terrifying volcanic island, the snowy mountains of Nepal, or the jungles of Amazon River? Join her on her quest in this fantastic Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game! Dive into Sandra Fleming Chronicles: Crystal Skulls and go on an exciting journey!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168775.name: Tamara the 13th
168775.description:
Tamara McNamara has just discovered that she's a 13th generation witch! When her mother is kidnapped, in order to rescue her, she must master her innate magical powers and restore order to realms devastated by an evil witch. Can you help Tamara use her newfound abilities to solve puzzles and confront her mother's captor? Tamara the 13th is an inventory-based puzzle adventure game with an intuitive magic system. Unravel Tamara's heritage in this beautiful puzzle game!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168776.name: Esoterica: Hollow Earth
168776.description:
Jump into a classic sci-fi adventure as you tunnel through the earth itself on a hunt for the lost continent of Agartha in Esoterica: Hollow Earth. Are you ready to find hidden objects and solve devious puzzles? Experience the dazzling art, professional vocal work, and excellent production values of this hidden object game. Will you be able to outsmart the vile Count Stauffenberg? Keep your wits about you in Esoterica: Hollow Earth today!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168778.name: The Office Party
rpgseries: RPG Geek Fiasco Playset Contest 2014: Celebrations
168778.description:
From the Introduction:


"What I don't like about office Christmas parties is looking for a job the next day." -Phyllis Diller


In the corporate environment, the thin veneer of suits and smiles hides the savage truth: that underneath it all we are territorial animals driven by the selfish urges of lust and greed. After a year of stress, the office Christmas party is a chance to relax, to unwind, to let down your hair. But there are always those who go just that little bit too far and lose their carefully-constructed inhibitions.

Having been pushed to your limits, it's all too easy to let your self-control slip through your intoxicated fingers and let your baser instincts run amok. So ladies and gentlemen, raise your glasses in cheer at this festive time of the year and enjoy what you've worked so hard to achieve. Let's hope it was worth it come the morning. Merry Christmas!

168779.name: Pirate Mysteries
168779.description:
Pirate Mysteries: A Tale of Monkeys, Masks, and Hidden Objects

Save Mary’s father from the demon that possesses his body and escape the deserted island in Pirate Mysteries: A Tale of Monkeys, Masks, and Hidden Objects! After trying to fulfill his dream of becoming a pirate, Mary’s father’s brand new ship has crashed into an unknown island! With the rest of the crew dead, it’s up to Mary to save the day and rescue her father!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168780.name: Mystery of Mortlake Mansion
168780.description:
The old mansion has been living a mysterious life of its own. Explore the dark rooms of the house and discover the secrets that haunt this eerie place. Meet the talking raven and the Spirit, the enigmatic captives of the mansion. Confront the insidious lord, break the evil spells, set the captives free and become the owner of the gorgeous mansion. Numerous hours of adventures and discoveries await you in the Mortlake Mansion.

Source: The Developer Website.

168781.name: Chronicles of Albian: The Magic Convention
168781.description:
The Fairy Godmother, Gwendolyn, has called upon you to help prepare for the official Convention of Magic Masters in Chronicles of Albian! In only a few weeks, the wizards of the world will arrive at Albian for the magical convention, and it's up to you to get the castle ready in time! Search for hidden treasures among the many rooms to help finance the required repairs and upgrades to the castle grounds. Solve more than 80 puzzles as you adventure through the beautiful castle, seek and find thousands of unique objects, and enjoy a breathtaking instrumental soundtrack in Chronicles of Albian!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168782.name: Chronicles of Albian 2: The Wizbury School of Magic
168782.description:
Someone took the The Wizbury School of Magic's gold... and right before the Magician's Guild inspection, too! In Chronicles of Albian 2: The Wizbury School of Magic, you must search for the missing gold and help get the school ready for its inspection! Rebuild and upgrade the school by selling items you've found. Meet the quirky wizards, witches, students, ghosts and ghouls who live there. And, find that gold! Your school is counting on you in Chronicles of Albian 2: The Wizbury School of Magic. Download some magical school spirit today!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168783.name: Lost Realms: Legacy of the Sun Princess
168783.description:
Alexia's dreams have been brimming with mysterious visions that link her to an ancient Incan civilization. Now, she's determined to get answers at any cost. Join Alexia as she travels to exotic locations and seeks out the truth behind her dreams in Lost Realms - Legacy of the Sun Princess. Search for hidden clues at 30 beautiful, exotic locations, and rack your brains to solve 17 mini-games. Play either Relaxed or Adventure Mode, and help Alexia on her quest for self-discovery. Lost Realms - Legacy of the Sun Princess is a captivating seek-and-find game that transports the player to the land back in time!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168784.name: Lost Realms: The Curse of Babylon
168784.description:
During a trip to Turkey to visit her friend Ogan, Alexia is puzzled by a strange curse affecting him and his family. This curse is progressively taking Ogan’s life. The only way to help him is to investigate the strange curse of Babylon. A difficult task, considering all the awaiting dangers Alexia must face in this Hidden Object-Adventure Game.

Source: The Developer Website.

NOTE: This is a sequel to the game Lost Realms: Legacy of the Sun Princess

168785.name: Name That...! Person, Place, Thing...
168785.description:
Name That...! Person, Place, Thing... is the quick thinking name game in which 2 or more players, 6 years and older, race to be the first to call out an acceptable answer to the category starting with a given letter. The game consists of a deck of 50 cards, and the object of the game is to finish with the most cards.

To begin play, the deck is shuffled thoroughly and placed face up in a pile on the playing surface. Designate a dealer who will read the categories and starting letters for the first round. The dealer reads aloud the category on the top card and then places it next to the deck to reveal the letter on the next card. Players race to call out an answer to the category starting with the letter revealed on the next card. The first player to call out an acceptable answer wins the first card. In the event of no answer or a tie, the card is set aside and the next winner of a card wins both cards. Play continues until all but the last card has been won. The player with the most cards wins.

Note: This is not the same as Name That...! Person, Place, Thing..., even though it has the same name, and was published in the same year, by the same publisher.

168786.name: Girl's Time
168786.description:
Girl's Time is a 2-5 player bluffing game. The player that gets the most money will win the game.

In this game, there are two customers on the table and they need some goods such as shoes, clothes, etc. Each player has three cards and on their turn must choose one of three actions:

1. Play cards: You can play up to three cards, face-down, so you can bluff. If somebody think you are bluffing, they may call "check" and reveal all of your cards this turn. If they called your bluff correctly, you must pay them $100 per card, otherwise they pay you $100 per card.

2. Finish a sale: If you think most cards on a customer are correct, you can finish the set and sell them. If most cards are correct, you can earn lots of money. On the other hand, if most cards are incorrect, you have to pay money back to the customer.

3. Change your cards: pay $200, redraw five cards and keep three.

This game is very is to learn and play. In most case, if you want to play correct card, you have to trick the other players because they want to "check" you. If you want to play an incorrect card, you have to trick them to sell the product and lose lots of money. In this game, trickery is the most important thing.

168787.name: Pithecus
168787.description:
Pithecus is a simple close tactical combat game. The players control groups of early primates: Ramapithecus on one side and Australopithecus on the other.

The primates are rated for strength, movement, and morale. Each may take one of four actions (attack, stay, flee, or fight) each turn, but must make a morale check first. There are some simple terrain rules. Wounds and death are recorded by rotating the "counters," which are actually folded paper cubes.

Two maps are provided, each in two sections.

The game was one of Kaylor and Humrichouser's Games With Depth, which all used folded 3D paper pieces.

Note: Ramapithecus is today not regarded as its own genus, and in any case lived millions of years before any of the Australopithecus species.

boardgameintegration: Rum & Bones: Second Tide
Rum & Bones: Second Tide
168788.description:
Avast ye pirates! Gather your crews and set sail for adventure on the high seas in Rum & Bones!

Based on online MOBA (Multiplayer Online Battle Arena) style games, Rum & Bones has 2-6 players taking control of legendary pirate heroes, each with unique powers and abilities, as their crews fight over Davy Jones' legendary treasure!

Players will each control up to five heroes at any time, moving them across the game board in an attempt to destroy various key features across their opponents ship. Victory is obtained by destroying enough of these features. Your heroes are not alone, however, as your crew also consists of deckhands and bosuns who, while not controlled by the player, will work on a simple AI to wreak havoc on the enemy!

Of course, what would pirates be without plunder? And in Rum & Bones the most sought after treasure are Davy Jones' mythical pieces of eight! Players will amass these powerful coins during gameplay to unleash devastating abilities and attacks from their Heroes, crushing all enemies before them until only they remain!
168788.name: Rum & Bones
boardgameaccessory: Rum & Bones: Albrecht the Damned – Christmas Edition
Rum & Bones: Miss Mags – Valentines Day Edition
boardgamepodcastepisode: 11-16-15: MACE, T.I.M.E Stories, The Cave, Coup Rebellion G54, Perceived value of consumable games
Ameritrashed: Episode #11
Cool Mini or Not Board Games Review Special
Episode 15: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!, Trading Places, and Cardinal Quest
Episode 36 - Rum and Bones
Episode 58- Dead of Winter and Horror Board Games
NJAGP At The Table #1: Rum & Bones (first impressions)
RDTN Episode 76 – Cold As Ice: Eric Lang, The Others 7 Sins, L5R, World of Smog, Rum & Bones and TBT Contest
The Game Pit: Episode 40 - Council Chamber Mega Review of 2014 with Top 5s

168789.name: Wedge-It
168789.description:
Wedge-It is played on a board of forty equilateral triangles arranged in a hexagonal grid. Each player has nine pieces which are equilateral triangles with handles (these are created by cutting and folding provided sheets).

The handle of each piece identifies its front. A piece may move into the space adjacent to its front by rotating around either adjacent vertex. A piece may also jump an opposing piece if its front is adjacent to one of the opposing piece's sides.

The object is to make it impossible for the opponent to move.

This is one of Kaylor and Humrichouser's "Games With Depth," all of which had folded 3D paper pieces.

168790.name: GURPS High-Tech: Adventure Guns
168790.description:
From the publisher:

Armed For Adventure

The mid-19th through early 20th centuries were the time of rough-and-tumble Wild West gunslingers and gentlemanly Victorian adventurers alike, an age when death was just a bullet away whether you found yourself in a sooty industrial metropolis or the wilds of the Great White Hunter. With so many people living and dying by the gun, gunsmiths were spurred to revolutionize the art of killing and develop the innovations that made the Great War the bloody spectacle it was. GURPS High-Tech: Adventure Guns brings heroes of this period everything they need to shoot their way out of trouble:


Both iconic and unusual firearms from the mid-1800s through early 1900s -- revolvers, semiautomatic pistols, shotguns, rifles, machine guns, and even a few cannon -- complete with their accessories and variants.
All the associated gear: ammo, cartridge belts, fast-draw rigs, and hand grenades that don't rely on a fizzing fuse.
Rules unique to period designs, covering both defects and innovations . . . which were often one and the same!
Support for the crazy stuff that adventurers get up to, like customizing weapons, improvising ammo, rigging traps, and even mounting TL5-6 cannon and machine guns on steampunk spacecraft.
Bits and pieces needed to get into costume: the history and description of each weapon, a glossary of slang, guidelines for converting costs to period currency, and notes on firearms legality.


GURPS High-Tech: Adventure Guns takes a magnifying glass to one of the most interesting eras covered by GURPS High-Tech and reveals details that will have your TL5-6 heroes shooting up the scenery in style.

168791.name: Islamic Jihad: "The Mother of All Surrenders"
168791.description:
Islamic Jihad is a parodic micro-game about the first Gulf War. It can be played by any number of players, each of whom represents an Iraqi Army commander. Each commander has 100 troops and must travel 10 miles (in 1/10 mile increments) in order to surrender to American troops.

Play is entirely driven by die rolls. Each turn players roll on a main table which directs them to roll on one of six other tables, which may require more dice rolls, etc. Eventually each player will find that they move backwards or forwards some number of spaces or lose some number of troops.

168792.description:
The date: March 1938. The vast majority of Austrians cheer the Anschluss of their country by the German Reich. Central Europe is falling into Nazi hands and all the best European scientists will soon compete under the aegis of Heinrich Himmler, for whom no scheme is too wild or too improbable — but which team has the imagination, the courage, and the drive to most successfully accomplish their goals?

Secret Weapons of the Third Reich is a game for one to four players simulating the arms race of World War II from the German perspective. From secret submarine bases in Greenland to the mysterious Base 211 in Neuschwabenland, Antarctica, this game recreates the incredible tales of Nazi technology, from the famous V-1 buzz bombs and V-2 rockets to the unlikely flying saucers derived from the work of Nikola Tesla. Will players be able to deliver the Haunebu project to completion? Will Hans Kammler escape with his last battalion of flying saucers to the dark side of the moon? Will the secret submarine fleet sail to Antarctica to pursue the war after the war? Or could German scientists produce an atomic bomb to be dropped on New York by an electro-gravitational flying saucer or within the warhead of a futuristic intercontinental V-3? Would it even be possible to build a huge solar satellite gun to strike America?

In the game, each player controls one or more research groups, each working on a secret weapon project. Each research group has a leading researcher, who provides an initial bonus (expressed in resource cubes or scientist cylinders) when the project is assigned. The researcher has a regime loyalty value that measures both the ability to make requisition attempts and the ability to resist opposing attempts.

A player tries to get their projects approved, then completed. Certain requirements (resource cubes and/or scientist cylinders and technologies attached to projects) must be met and costs paid in order to reach the stage of development of a project. Each turn, approved projects generate specific amounts of resource cubes as funding. Completed projects award victory points (VP) and allow, in most cases, weapon production. Produced weapons award VP to the owning player in addition to helping to achieve a cooperative goal for all players. In fact, if together the players fail to reach a certain number of weapons produced by the end of the game, they all lose. The weapon production goal varies depending on the number of players.

Play begins in 1938, one year before the outbreak of world war. At the start, players can only place research groups for their approved projects (project plants) in the portion of the map representing Germany and Austria. In 1939 and later, the conquests of Nazi Germany allow players to deploy their project plants in occupied European territories — but players will have to pay attention to the various locations because some areas allow only research and development, others only weapon production, and still others only research and development for U-Boat projects.

Also, players must operate in a "state of warfare". This means that as time goes on they are more and more subject to enemy bombardments that can cause a great loss of resources and technologies. In addition, as starting in 1943 Allied and Soviet advances on Berlin make the map progressively smaller, players must face logistical issues never encountered during the early years of the war.

Should a completed project or produced weapon fall into Allied hands, players not only lose VP, but the weapons production goal recedes as well! Thus a certain amount of player cooperation is a must. Each player must balance his personal interests with the common need to share technologies and resources in order to fulfill the common goal.

Last, but not least, via events one player may secretly become the turncoat, working in the shadows to help the enemy, and winning the game if all players would otherwise lose.
168792.name: Secret Weapons of the Third Reich
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG 10: Meer Essen

168793.name: Helvéczia: pikareszk szerepjáték
168793.description:
Publisher's Description:

A Helvéczia szerepjáték szabályainak gyűjteménye. Ez a kiadvány ismerteti mindazt, amire egy játékosnak szüksége lehet. Bemutatja a szerepjáték játékmenetét, tárgyalja a karakterkészítés lépéseit, és egyszerű, de rugalmas szabályokat ad a harcra, varázslatok használatára, a bűnös és erényes viselkedés következményeire, és még sok más egyébre. Tartalmaz még egy részletes varázslatlistát, összefoglaló leírást Helvécziáról és tartományairól, ajánlott irodalmi forrásokat és több példát a játékmenetről és a szabályok alkalmazásáról.

User Translation from Magyar:

The Helvéczia collection of role-playing rules. This publication describes all the things a player may need. It describes the process of role-playing gaming, the character creation steps are discussed, a simple but flexible set of combat rules, using magic spells, the consequences of shameful and virtuous behavior, and much more. It also contains a detailed list of spells, and a summary description of the Helvécziáról region with recommended literature resources and more examples of the gameplay and the application of the rules.

168794.name: Helvéczia: Mesélői Almanach
168794.description:
Publisher's Description:

Ezt a füzetet csak a mesélőnek kell áttanulmányoznia. A játék világában található ellenfelek és csudálatos tárgyak leírásain túl segítséget nyújt a szabályok használatában, a játékvezetésben, és különösen az új kalandok kidolgozásában. Útmutatásai egyszerű, de bevált és jól használható módszereket nyújtanak kezdő és haladó mesélőknek az alapvető párbeszédtechnikáktól a fantasztikus tájak és ördögi tervek kidolgozásáig. A füzetben található egy egyszerű, kezdőkre szabott bevezető kaland, és egy függeléknyi inspiráló segédanyag is.

User Translation from Magyar:

This booklet should only be read by the story-teller. Found here are opponents and descriptions of magic items for the game world, and also help in using the rules, running the game, and especially developing new adventures. The instructions are simple, but good and useful to provide beginner and advanced story-tellers the fundamental dialogue techniques, and how to develop fantastic settings and fiendish campaigns. The booklet includes a simple beginners' customised introductory adventure, and an appendix of inspirational content.

168795.name: Compendium Arkanum Volume 04: 3rd-Level Spells
168795.description:
From publisher blurb:

Compendium Arcanum Volume 4: 3rd-Level Spells continues where volume 3 left off! This book includes 110+ pages of 3rd-Level spells for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, now with Heightened and Diminished effects!

A multi-variable spell is a spell which, once learned, you can cast as a spell one level higher or lower than the original spell. This mechanic was first introduced in Monte Cook’s Arcana Evolved. Multi-variable spells give spellcasters great flexibility and so Tim decided to begin by adding the Heightened and Diminished qualities to Pathfinder spells.

So, in addition to the normal Pathfinder spell details, you will see one or two new bits of text, specifically, either a “Diminished Effects” line, a “Heightened Effects” line, or both. This is the first book of a set intended to include all spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook, Advanced Player’s Guide, Ultimate Combat, and Ultimate Magic, now with heightened and diminished effects.

'DIMINISHED EFFECTS

This section describes changes to the spell if it is cast using a slot one Level lower than normal. You must be able to cast a spell at its regular Level before you can use the diminished effects. If you use a diminished effect, treat the spell as one Level lower than listed for purposes of spell slot used, saving throw DCs, magic item pricing, and so on. Spells that are 0-level (or 1st-level alchemist-, paladin-, or ranger-only spells) have no diminished effects.

HEIGHTENED EFFECTS

This section describes changes to the spell if it is cast using a slot one Level higher than normal. If you use a heightened effect, treat the spell as one Level higher than listed, for purposes of spell slot used, saving throw DCs, magic item pricing, and so on, regardless of what Level slot you use. Spells that are 9th Level (or 6th-level alchemist-only spells or 4th-level paladin- or ranger-only spells) have no heightened effects.

168796.name: Compendium Arkanum Volume 03: 2nd-Level Spells
168796.description:
From publisher blurb:

Compendium Arcanum Volume 3: 2nd-Level Spells continues where volume 1 and 2 left off! This book includes 120+ pages of 2nd-Level spells for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, now with Heightened and Diminished effects!

A multi-variable spell is a spell which, once learned, you can cast as a spell one level higher or lower than the original spell. This mechanic was first introduced in Monte Cook’s Arcana Evolved. Multi-variable spells give spellcasters great flexibility and so Tim decided to begin by adding the Heightened and Diminished qualities to Pathfinder spells.

So, in addition to the normal Pathfinder spell details, you will see one or two new bits of text, specifically, either a “Diminished Effects” line, a “Heightened Effects” line, or both. This is the first book of a set intended to include all spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook, Advanced Player’s Guide, Ultimate Combat, and Ultimate Magic, now with heightened and diminished effects.

'DIMINISHED EFFECTS

This section describes changes to the spell if it is cast using a slot one Level lower than normal. You must be able to cast a spell at its regular Level before you can use the diminished effects. If you use a diminished effect, treat the spell as one Level lower than listed for purposes of spell slot used, saving throw DCs, magic item pricing, and so on. Spells that are 0-level (or 1st-level alchemist-, paladin-, or ranger-only spells) have no diminished effects.

HEIGHTENED EFFECTS

This section describes changes to the spell if it is cast using a slot one Level higher than normal. If you use a heightened effect, treat the spell as one Level higher than listed, for purposes of spell slot used, saving throw DCs, magic item pricing, and so on, regardless of what Level slot you use. Spells that are 9th Level (or 6th-level alchemist-only spells or 4th-level paladin- or ranger-only spells) have no heightened effects.

168797.name: The Playbooks of the Dead
168797.description:
From publisher blurb:

WARNING: Aside from some art, there is no unique content in this book that you won't find in the original playbooks.

Whether a player botches their last breath, or you are looking for something "fresher" than a fighter, wizard, or variation thereof, death doesn't have to be the end!

The Playbooks of the Dead is a compilation of our four undead playbooks — the ghoul, mummy, skeleton, and vampire — all in one book.

In addition to customized, letter-sized sheets for each class, you also get a 78-page digest-sized book that contains:

Everything you need to know about each class.
Excess moves that we just couldn't fit on the sheets.
New weapons, armor, dungeon gear, and magic items.
The vampire spawn compendium class.
A pair of vampiric monsters.
A behind the scenes look at each class, including ways to tweak the them, and an explanation, clarification, and/or interpretation of some of the potentially confusing moves.

168798.name: Berin Kinsman's Kaiju Patrol
168798.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the Futurons from Golden Planet 713 invade the Earth, they use giant monsters under control to bring chaos and destruction to cities all over the world! Only fearless members of the Patrol can save the day!

Berin Kinsman's Kaiju Patrol is inspired by Japanese tokusatsu programs, live-action special effects films and television shows. If you love Godzilla, Ultraman, Giant Robo, Power Rangers, or any similar science fiction epics along those lines, this game is for you!

Be a henshin hero! Be a kyodai hero! Pilot a flying sub! Ride in a giant robot! Battle daikaiju! Fight evil alien invaders!

168799.description:
These 5 Scenarios add new situations for the crash-landed crew of the Pioneer.

Scenario 7 is Radioactive, which affects Bugs and Shields!

Scenario 8 is Hard Impact, which damages the crew from the onset of the game.

Scenario 9 is Condition Unknown, which forces the players to repair the ship, but also introduces the "Special" tokens provided in the core game.

Scenario 10 is Prime Directive, and offers a solo play scenario!

Scenario 11 is Super Shields which makes use of the Special Shields Tokens and is designed to be an easier Scenario offering some extra Shield help.
168799.name: Alien Uprising: Scenario Promos

boardgameintegration: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
168800.description:
With the Legendary Villains: Fear Itself expansion for Legendary and Legendary: Villains, you can play through the "Fear Itself" storyline from Marvel Comics. This expansion consists of six new allies from The Worthy: Kuurth, Nul, Skirn, Nerkkod, Greithoth and Skadi; one new adversary group; one new commander; and three new plots.

Players can work both with and against other players to defeat Iron Man in his Uru Enchanted Armor as he leads the forces of The Mighty while laying waste to planet Earth!
168800.name: Legendary: Villains – Fear Itself

168801.name: Atlas Hârnica Map C6
168801.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map C6 covers the northwestern coast of the Kingdom of Rethem. The map covers a number of major settlements, including Tormau, held by Earl Denyl Lynnaeus, the most dangerous and powerful rival of Rethem's King Chafin III; Bedenes, held by the Warriors of Mameka and the base of thaat Agrikan fighting order's campaigns against the Kuboran tribes; Ithiko, birthplace of the Morgathian prophet Balsha; Winen, home to the Sheriff of Hohnam; and Dasen and Ithius, two keeps that strengthen the Earl of Tormau's grip on the region. The dominant natural features on the map are the Gulf of Pendos and Tirsa Islands, home to Kuboran tribesmen and bands of pirates that prey on coastal trade.

168803.name: Atlas Hârnica Map D6
168803.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map D6 features Shostim, the royal castle of Rethem the north coast of Boka Bay. Arketh, Zaza, Quiso and Quste keeps are also on the map.

168804.name: Atlas Hârnica Map D7
168804.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map D7 includes Selvos Castle, Tesien, Golotha and Hyen Keep.

168805.name: Atlas Hârnica Map D8
168805.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map D8 includes Dunir Keep and the vast Ternu Heath.

168806.name: Atlas Hârnica Map D9
168806.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map D9 includes Sarkum Castle, Hebon Keep and the windswept south coast of Kanday.

168807.name: Atlas Hârnica Map E7
168807.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map E7 covers the region where Tharda, Kanday, and Rethem all intersect. Coranan, the largest city on Hârn lies at the eastern edge of the map in the Gerium Province. The Kandian castles of Menekod and Heroth dominate the middle part of the map. A half-dozen Rethemi keeps/castles guard the Thard River at the north edge of the map.

168808.name: Atlas Hârnica Map E8
168808.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map E8 includes Kanday's largest city, Aleath and the royal seat of Dyrisa.

168809.name: Atlas Hârnica Map E9
168809.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map E9 includes the coastal keeps of Avertu, Gimon, and Minilaous.

168810.name: Misyn
168810.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map H4 covers the northern part of Misyn, the rough wilderness area at the juncture of the Rayesha and Felsha mountain ranges in north-central Hârn. The area is home to the Lucrain, Huxuth, and Bwaft colonies of Gargun, the feared Hârnic orcs. Various sorts of Ivashu, the strange and often dangerous beasts created by the god Ilvir, roam this region, near to the deity's home at Araka-Kalai. Ilvir's Trail, the route taken by Ilviran pilgrims traveling from Orbaal to Araka-Kalai, is the major trail here.

168811.name: Atlas Hârnica Map J4
168811.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map J4 covers northern Kaldor, including Baseta, Bidow, Setrew, Tonot, and Yeged keeps. The region to north of this settled area is controlled by Taelda barbarians.

168812.name: Atlas Hârnica Map J5
168812.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map J5 includes the Royal Seat of Tashal at Olokand and Tashal, the second largest city on Hârn.

168813.name: Atlas Hârnica Map J6
168813.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map J6 covers southwestern Kaldor and parts of Evael, the Elven Kingdom. Jedes Keep is the only major civilized area. South of the Osel River lies a large area known as the Oselmarch, claimed by Kaldor, but controlled by Pagaelin tribesmen. Pagaelin villages are named and located on the map along with the native names of lakes and rivers. The impassable Tuleme Falls and vast Linor Bog are the dominant natural features. The map area is bounded to the south by the Shomos River.

168814.name: Atlas Hârnica Map K4
168814.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map K4 covers Northeastern Kaldor and parts of Azadmere, the Dwarven Kingdom. Gardiren is the only major civilized area. Much of the territory claimed by Kaldor is controlled by Taelda tribesmen or Gargun. Barbarian villages are named and located on the map along with the native names of lakes and rivers. The high Sorkin Mountains and their foothills are the dominant natural features. The Silver Way, the only trade route to Azadmere, starts at Gardiren on this map.

168815.name: Atlas Hârnica Map K5
168815.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map K5 covers eastern Kaldor including most of Vemionshire, Balimshire, Thelshire and southern Nephshire. Dominated by the important castles of Kiban and Minarsas, this region is also where the Silver Way from Azadmere enters civilized Kaldor.

168816.name: Atlas Hârnica Map K6
168816.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map K6 covers southeastern Kaldor including the major castle at Qualdris, seat of the Earl of Osel. Hutop and Kobing keeps are the other major settlements on the map. Much of the region is the hilly Oselshire, however south of the Osel River is the disputed Oselmarch. Chybisa and Kaldor both covet the region which is presently occupied by the Pagaelin. The Warden of the Oselmarch, Baron Orsin Firith, leads frequent campaigns to quell the Pagaelin. Massacres and repisals have come to characterize the struggle in the region.

168817.name: Atlas Hârnica Map L5
168817.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map L5 covers the wild region north of Tontury Lake to Azadmere. It is a rugged hilly landscape traversed by the Selene and Guthe Rivers and a portion of the Silver Way trade route.

168818.name: Atlas Hârnica Map L6
168818.description:
Publisher blurb:

Atlas Hârnica map L6 covers the southern portion of Tontury Lake and the Ilmen Marsh, home to the mysterious Ilme meredragons. From the lakeshore, the land rises to the southeast into wild country controlled by the Ruthuba Gargu-Arak. Pagelin villages are found along the Osel and Ilmen rivers in the southwest corner of the map.

168819.name: Redemption: A Game of Tactics and Consequences
168819.description:
From publisher blurb:

The War for Humanity's place in the stars rages on!

For five years, war has raged between the Terran Sphere Confederacy and the Shohan. Overturning 100 years of peace between the two races, the Shohan have captured half of humanity's worlds. As each world fell, only silence remained. Now, the Terran Sphere has won its first major battle, stopping the Shohan on the doorstep of its core worlds and the war’s momentum teeters on the edge...

Soldier. Captain. Admiral.

As a soldier in the Terran Sphere Navy, be it a marine infiltrating behind enemy lines, a captain of ship patrolling the front lines, or an admiral in command of the fleets charged with humanity's defense, your actions and their consequences will have an impact on the fates of all the human worlds.

Refugee. Guerilla. Diplomat.

However, the war's effects extend far beyond the battlefield. Refugees have fled the war altogether, trying to start a new life in the fringes, but it may be a case of out of the frying pan and into the fire. In alien halls of power, diplomats struggle to contain a dozen crises as other powers sense blood in the water. Meanwhile, resistance groups on the occupied worlds continue to fight for their freedom, and may have discovered an important clue to the Shohan's motivations.

Redemption is a tabletop Military Sci Fi roleplaying game. The game is intended to support group play through multiple levels of combat - from firefights to fleet actions - and to give groups a wide range of toolkits from designing their own gear to bringing about social change as they make their way through a galaxy overturned by war.

168820.name: The Ancient Past
168820.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ancient Past contains eight playbooks of player classes for Dungeon World that has gorgeous cover art done by Nick Ladd. This pack features adventurers who are tied to the world and its ancient past.

The Ageless: You are an immortal adventure who has learned to escape death’s grasp and avoid the cruel hand of physically ageing. Even if the weight of the ages is taking a toll on your mind, you are font of power and knowledge from across the ages. However, death can only be denied for so long…
The All-Powerful: You were born at the dawn of time along with the gods. You are far more powerful than any mortal hero could ever hope to be. However, as time goes on, the divine energies you were birthed in are fading. Each use of your powers brings you closer to exhausting this irreplaceable energy which one day may fully run out.
The Curseburdened: Once an adventure with hope in your heart and a spring in your step, excited for your greatest adventure yet. It was going all so well till you and your original party disturbed a seal containing all of the worst curses throughout the world’s history. Now you live an s a paranoid adventure, simply waiting till the curses take hold.
The Doomed: You are a pathetic as you are poor. You are a weak, disgusting, disease ridden beggar who openly suffers more than anyone else in the world. This class is only for masochist or ambitious players who wish to weather the storm of miserableness that will be heading your way if you play this class. But it’s not all without its perks, for if you can make it to the end alive with this poor soul he becomes a great and powerful hero that could have only been forged in those terrible trials no other human could have survived.
The Imprisoned: You are the first sinner, imprisoned by the gods at the dawn of time for your crimes so terrible they would not chance them being visited on the world again. Now that countless ages have passed you have escaped your prison and are now a fugitive fleeing from the gods themselves.
The Relicbearer: You possessed ancient magical treasure from around the world that have still maintained their use to this date. You can choose from a wide and colorful range of relics to own which to aid your party with in a moment’s notice. In a pinch, a GM could use the list of relics in this playbook for some nifty treasures to reward their players with in their games.
The Stone Guardian: You yourself are a relic that survived from an ancient civilization now long forgotten to history. You are a living statue who must find a purpose and a new people to protect as you set off into the world.
The Traveler: The knowledgeable traveler who has seen much of the world. You know where all the best inns are at, the most beautiful landscapes and the most dangerous dungeons. You are always well stocked and well liked most places you stop at.

168821.name: Undead Conspiracy
168821.description:
From publisher blurb:

Undead Conspiracies contains eight playbooks of player classes for Dungeon World that has gorgeous cover art done by Nick Ladd. This pack features undead adventurers who band together to defeat those who would undo their schemes. With eight classes in the bundle you have enough choices to make an entire undead party.

The Deathbringer: You are a powerful undead eternally sworn to Death himself. Encased in armor and armed with an weapon Death himself has granted you, you adventure out into the world to send him more soul.
The Entombed Sorcerer: You are an ancient sorcerer mummified and put to rest in your tomb. Your final resting place has been disturbed and now you are free to walk the world again.
The Lich: The diabolical undead magician masters dark sorceries and harvests bodies of the living. All the corpses you come across is your campaign is merely a source to fuel your future undead army with.
The Phantom Warrior: You are the lingering apparition of a warrior slain in the battlefield. Doomed to wander the earth without rest you return to the only trade you knew in life.
The Returned: Bummed your favorite character died and that they will be gone forever? Not anymore! The Returned has two playable options for you to choose from. The first lets you play an undead version of your character who just died while the second is an adventurer who died a while ago and has been undead ever since.
The Sticher: You are the deranged undead surgeon who uses his medical knowledge to stich your careless party members back together after they get wrecked in the dungeon. You can also provide surgical grafts to your thankless party members and yourself. Results may vary.
The Unliving Aristocrat: You were in death as you were in life: As pompous as you are filthy rich. Money can buy everything, even an eternal existence in the form of an undead noble. Use your money and pretentious rapier skills to upstage your party members with.
The Vampiric Magus: You are the more dangerous breed of vampire who has spent their unliving existence mastering magic. The blood you steal from your victims has provided a wonderful fuel for your mastery of blood magic.

168822.name: Valtarius's Retreat
168822.description:
From publisher blurb:

This adventure begins with the party chasing down a thief who has procured the crown of a local Marquis. The trail goes to a northern border community in the dead of winter and potentially ends at the ruins known as Valtarius's Retreat which secured the border in the “old days”. The ruins are currently home to a dreaded Dracolich who will most likely not care to be disturbed by a group of adventurers! Can the party recover the crown and remain alive?

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a higher level group of adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

168823.description:
Description from the publisher:

As it boots up the SanSan Cycle, The Valley transports players deep into the heart of SanSan, the number one place for all the top tech. This American megacity sprawls along the California coastline from San Diego in the south to San Francisco in the north. There, you'll also find Biotech Valley, most often called just "the Valley", home to the world's biggest biotech firms and its most advanced genomic research. Home, additionally, to Jinteki Corporation's flagship American R&D facility, the J-Plex.

With its sixty cards (3 copies each of 20 different cards), Android: Netrunner – The Valley explores Biotech Valley and its massive investment into bleeding-edge bioengineering. This is a meatspace heavily colored by genengineering, a highly educated workforce, tech startups, capital investments, and the presence of Jinteki's J-Plex. You'll find numerous assets, region upgrades, genetic resources, and a new Jinteki identity. Of course, even in the Valley, you'll need more than good genes to get by; you’ll also find new programs, ice, and currents for both Corps and Runners.
168823.name: Android: Netrunner – The Valley
boardgamepodcastepisode: Breaking News — Episode 35

168824.name: Scum and Villainy: The Igornamota
168824.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the eleventh issue of Going Postal, a series of supplements for the Mutant Future role-playing game by Goblinoid Games.

This introduces a new monster suitable for long term annoyance of player characters. The Igornamota are evil by every sense of the word but at the same time can offer services to player characters willing to deal with the devil. Whether you are seeking a stereotypical villain race that provides more than a single session's worth of entertainment or a means to give PCs a means to more technologically advanced equipment, the Igornamota are willing to trade anything for flesh.

This issue provides the Mutant Lord everything needed to just drop in these villains to any existing game including a new race of minions, a new mutation/power, and a typical Igornamota base of operations.

168825.name: Plague Inc: Evolved
videogamehonor: 2014 Global Game Awards Best Early Access Game of the Year Nominee
168825.description:
Can you infect the world? Your pathogen has just infected 'Patient Zero'. Now you must bring about the end of human history by evolving a deadly, global Plague whilst adapting against everything humanity can do to defend itself. Plague Inc: Evolved is a unique mix of high strategy and terrifyingly realistic simulation which is now available on PC and Mac via Steam Early Access. Plague Inc. has infected over 35 million players to date and has now been entirely redeveloped for PC and Mac. Get ready to take strategy gaming to the next level!

Plague Inc: Evolved combines the original critically acclaimed gameplay with significant, all-new features:

• Infectious Multiplayer - cooperative and competitive gameplay modes let you team up to fight the cure with friends, or compete in a race to kill the world.
• Contagious Content Creator - hit the lab and develop your own custom scenarios - creating new plague types and worlds. Bring your deadliest ideas to life and share them with Steam Workshop.
• Blinding Graphics - Including full 3D disease models taking you closer to your plague than ever before, city-cams showing humanity's struggle at street level, and the body scanner highlighting the full effect of your mutations, organ by organ.
• Deadly Data - Predict government responses with priority indicators, geek out with loads of new stats and graphs, and analyse your best strategies with end-of-game replays.
And much more!

It’s You vs. the world - only the strongest can survive!

Source: The Developer Website.

168826.description:
Cabriole is a medium-weight worker placement, card drafting, and resource management game for 2-4 players aged 13 and up, and playable in 60-90 minutes.

Set in London during the early 1700's, players aim to create the most successful furniture studios by hiring skilled craftsmen such as carvers, joiners, and turners; purchasing raw materials such as wood and silk; and fulfilling customer orders for tables, chairs, and cabinets. Players must balance the need for capital with the importance of increasing their studio's prestige throughout the city. The player who has scored the most prestige points at the end of eight rounds (nine rounds in a three-player game) is declared the winner.
168826.name: Cabriole

168827.name: A Spiteful Legacy
168827.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hate never dies!

When a local hero passes away, a former foe absconds with his body to enact the second phase of his terrible revenge.
