It is up to a new batch of heroes to trek into the foothills of sinister Bright Mountain and retrieve the fallen champions corpse for proper burial before it's too late.

An introductory Shattered Skies® adventure for 1st level characters. Compatible with the Pathfinder Rules System and easily adapted to any campaign setting.

Featuring a new Reputation Score system that seperates true heroes from run-of-the-mill adventurers.

168828.name: Mythic Aliens: The Kassars
168828.description:
From publisher blurb:

Close Encounters of the Mythic Kind!

Whether you’re encountering them on a distant planet in a far-off nebula, or they’ve come to you, and are abducting innocent villagers for nefarious purposes, there’s nothing quite like a strange, alien race to help breathe some life into your galaxy—and your game. Some Pathfinder products have even explored the idea of alien life in the past, and it’s certainly true that many aberrations could serve as alien creatures in a pinch. But there’s one thing that Pathfinder aliens have never been until now, and that is…mythic.

This book presents the Kassars, a race of lizard-like humanoids who hail from the planet Kassar V. Tough and cunning, through strength of arms and subtle manipulation the Kassar people have managed to become a dominant force throughout much of the galaxy. Indeed, their reach extends far further than most realize, as the mythically gifted kassar secret society known as the Sla’hert have been using their impressive shapeshifting powers in order to infiltrate and control governments big and small in total secrecy.

168829.name: Archmagery
168829.description:
Archmagery is a battle of duelling mages, their summoned monsters, dazzling and devastating spells, and powerful magical items, where only the cleverest – or sometimes luckiest – wizard will rise to ultimate power and can claim the title of Archmage!

The aim of the game is to become the most powerful wizard, which can be achieved in a number of ways, from eliminating all your rival wizards, to gaining the Artefacts of Power. Although let’s be honest – killing your opponents to win is much more fun!

Game features include:

Eight wizards, aligned to the spheres of power: Earth, Air, Fire, Water, Animal, Plant, Acid, and Death.
A host of monsters from lowly kobolds, skeletons, and gnolls, through to the might of creatures such as the dragon vine, the battle giant, and the iron golem.
A compendium of spells including those that will transform monsters, steal your opponents’ magic, deflect spells away, bind monsters immobile, strengthen and weaken monsters, and more.
A hoard of treasures including rings and amulets that grant magical immunity, enchanted horns to summon monsters to battle, magical weapons, powerful arcana to increase spellcasting power, and more.
Fast and furious game play with battling monsters and spell-slinging as each wizard strives for supremacy.

168830.name: Roudan maa - Kalevalainen fantasiamaailma
168830.description:
Translated from back of the book (not retaining the Kalevala-poem-rythmic):
Welcome to a mythical finnish adventure. Do you dare to step into dark woods, raft down the whitest rapids of Lapland, encounter the trolls and goblins on their own grounds, sail with teh son of Lemminkäinen to Stonehill and fight Tarvas under the aurora borealis?

This is a travel guide to Roudan maa (eng. Frozen land), time and place of heroes, mythological viking era Finland. there teh kalevalaic heroes are once more ready to don the battle gear and defend their families and fields agains foe and deathly horrors.

The book is made primarily as a source book for roleplaying games and it is suitable to be used with most fantasy RPGs. Roudan maa does not include any rules system and even for people unfamiliar with RPGs the book will offer an unforgettable glimpsto mythical world. It is a material package, that you can use to liven up kalevalaic worldand adventures in there. Roudan maa is suitable for both LARP and table top RPG.

Included inside:
- Numerous interesting adventure locations
- Most important sages, richest traders, scariest crooks: short descriptions of tens of most important NPCs
- Many finnish mythological magic items
- Wide description of kalevalaic and lappish cultures
- Monsters, that you can't find in any other part of the world
- Life style descriptions of most prominent elf groups

Back of the book in finnish:
"Kylmässä kyntämähän, vilussa värisemähän"
Tervetuloa muinaissuomalaiseen seikkailuun. uskallatko astua korpien kätköihin, laskea Lapin kuohuvimmat kosket, kohdata metsien peikot ja hiidet niiden omalla maalla, purjehtia Lemminkäisen pojan seurassa Isman Kivimäelle ja taistella Tarvasta vastaan revontulien loisteessa?

Tämä on matkaopas Roudan maahan, sankareiden aikaan ja paikkaan, mytologiselle viikiajan Suomenniemelle. Siellä kalevalaiset sankarit ovat vielä kerran valmiit vyöttämään vainovaatteet ja puolustamaan perheitään ja peltojaan vainolaisia ja kalman kauhuja vastaan.

Teos on tehty ensisijaisesti roolipelien lähdekirjaksi ja se soveltuu käytettäväksi useimpien fantasiaroolipelien tukena. Roudan maa ei sisällä mitään pelisysteemiä ja roolipelejä tuntemattomillekin kirja tarjoaa unohtumattoman kurkistuksen myyttiseen maailmaan. kyseessä on materiaalipakkaus, jonka avulla voit elävöittää kalevalaista maailmaa ja sinne sijoittuvia seikkailuja. Roudan maa soveltuu sekä näytelmäroolipeleihin että pöytäroolipeleihin.

Sisältä paljastuu mm.
- Lukuisia mielenkiintoisia seikkailupaikkoja
- Tärkeimmät tietäjät, rikkaimmat kauppiaat, pelottavimmat konnat: lyhyet kuvaukset kymmenistä merkittävistä henkilöistä.
- Paljon suomalaisen mytolgian taikaesineitä käyttötarkoituksineen
- Kalevalaisen ja lappalaisen kulttuurin laajat kuvaukset
- Hirviöitä, joita ei löydä mistään muusta maailmankolkasta
- Elämäntapakuvaukset tärkeimmistä haltiaryhmistä

168831.name: KaBlooey
168831.description:
KaBlooey is a light-hearted party card game that pits player against player in a war for survival. Toss bombs, grenades and even nukes at each other in a bid to be the ultimate victor in this fast-paced game of bluffing and strategy for 3 to 8 players.

The object of KaBlooey is to destroy your opponents’ Bases by blowing the living hell out of them with bombs, grenades, and any weapons you can get your hands on! Each enemy has 3 lives (Bases) and if you’re the last Bomber standing with 1 or more Bases at the end of any turn - you WIN! But, there’s a twist: the cards you play don’t have to be actual bombs! You can bluff your way to military supremacy with a non-Bomb card to try and get your opponents to waste their valuable resources. War is hell, and all’s fair in love and KaBlooey!

168832.name: Egypt: David vs. Goliath – The Italian-African Campaign
168832.description:
This is a WWII simulation about the campaign in North Africa. It is a typical hex and counter game with units representing regiments, brigades, and battalions maneuvering on a paper map. Players attempt to duplicate the historical results to achieve a victory.

Includes a sheet of uncut counters, a paper map, and a rule booklet. It was published in "Ziploc" format so there is no box.

168833.name: Anduin (Issue 93 - Dec 2007) Best of Anduin
168833.description:
After a hiatus of two years, Anduin returns with a best of issue, including

Trügerische Gewässer, a Blue Planet scenario by G. Hanrahan (Anduin #70)
Wasser: Vom Überleben im und ohne..., an article by T. Heinig (Anduin #70)
Rancher, Rinder und Revolver, an article by L. Perner (Anduin #76)
Greensilver, a Western location by C. Maser (Anduin 76)
Die Superpille, a LARP by P. & T. Heinig (Anduin #77)
Der Vampir-Inquisitor, a generic Horror scenario by F. Lelke (Anduin #81)
Wandertag, a generic Horror scenario by C. Böddicker (Anduin #84)
Der Geisterpirat, a DSA scenario by N. Hüttinger (Anduin #68)
and several other contributions...

168834.description:
Rocca Rails（ロッカ・レイル）は六角形のカードゲーム。同じ色の線路をつなげていきます。列車を出したら、もう一回プレイ。トンネルと嵐はいつでも出せます。嵐で何が起きるかは、サイコロをふって決まります。 イラストは植田真さん。 札幌MY RAIL PROJECTとコラボレーションしたゲームです。

Rocca Rails is a hexagon-shaped card game designed to look like a cube. Connect same colored railways. If you draw a train card, you can play one more time. Tunnel cards and storm cards can be drawn anytime. Only a dice knows what will happen when a storm card is drawn.

On a player's turn, they can play a card that connects to a similar color rail card on the table. Alternatively, if they are not able or don't want to do that action, they may draw a card.

The first player to empty their hand of cards wins the game.
168834.name: Rocca Rails

168835.name: Det Realistiske Travspill
168835.description:
A roll-and-move game for 2-8 people.
Players agree on how much monney each player gets at the start of the game.

Every player bets on which horse they want to race and then race their horse on the racing-track. If two or more players want to race the same horse, players draw which player gets to race the horse of choice.
Horse 1-4 starts on starting-line 1, and horse 5-8 on starting-line 2. All horses use the same goal-line. As a compensation for starting on starting-line 2, the last four horses get one extra die-roll during the race. The race runs for two rounds around the track.

It's not allowed to pass the horse in front of you in the same track. You have to pass horses by changing the track and pass on the inside or outside. It's only allowed to change track acording to the arrows on the gameboard. So sometimes you'll be blocked from using a good die-roll.

Around the track you'll find spots in diferent colors. Each color have their own special-effect.
Yellow: Double-spot.
Red: Miss the next move, and other horses may pass in the same track (there may be two horses in the red spot).
Green: Double the amount of your next die-roll.
Blue: Use only one die next die-roll.
Black: At the next die-roll, move forward only if getting dice of same value. Unless two-of-a-kind, move backwards in the same track according to the die-roll (you are not limited by other horses behind you).

The first player to pass the goal-line after two rounds wins the race and receives the money in the pot and from each player the same amount of money the winning player put on his horse before the race. Maximum bid on a horse is 500.

168836.name: Fate Codex (Vol 1, Issue 6 - Oct 2014)
rpgissuearticle: About The Fate Codex - Vol. 1, Issue 6

49 CREDITS
52 PATREON AND THE FATE CODEX

168837.name: Around The Horn
168837.description: While watching a baseball game, all players are dealt 7 cards. The remainder of the deck becomes the draw pile. Before each at bat, all players select one card from their hand, trying to predict the outcome of the at bat. Any number of players may select the same card. If the result of the play is a gomer or triple, player that selected that result receive 2 points. Any other result, players that selected a matching result receive 1 point. All cards selected cards are discarded replaces drawn and then next at bat is played. After the game ends the player with the most points wins.

168838.description:
The zombies are everywhere, they catch you by surprise and attach when you least expect it. By yourself you might be able to get through the crowd, but it's either all of you or none of you...that was the deal.

In Dead Things, the players need to work together to play against the game. Turn order and movement is controlled by a movement deck and the board is set up so that zombies appear in a programmed order, moving ahead of you if your characters move too slow.

The goal is to find gas, and car keys and leave the board before the zombies overwhelm the party.

Dead Things 3rd Edition is a board game that expands on the original Dead Things game. New maps, new challenges for 1-4 players.
168838.name: Dead Things: The Zombie Boardgame (Third Edition)

boardgamehonor: 2007 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
2007 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
168839.description:
Die Kutschfahrt zur Teufelsburg is a 3-10 player card game.

Turn actions:

Trade
Duel
Pass
Declare Victory by naming your team and who has the three items, starting with yourself




If a trade is rejected that is the end of that player's turn.

Duels: Beginning with the player to the attacker's left, players declare their support for attacker or defender in order. Apart from the attacker and defender, players can abstain.

Victory: Declare Victory by naming your team and who has the three items, starting with yourself, then one by one. If you name players on your team incorrectly or they don't have the object(s) you lose.
168839.name: Die Kutschfahrt zur Teufelsburg

168840.name: Bonje in de stal
168840.description:
Chaotic reaction game for the whole family.

You have to fill your stables with 1 male animal and at least 1 female animal of the same kind.
If you have 2 male animals in 1 stable, than you have "trouble in the stable" or in Dutch "Bonje in de stal".

All players flip a card at the same time, grab and play as fast as possible a card of your choice.
Animals you win have to put in your own stable. You can block or empty other stables with elephants, mad cows and crazy horses.
If you have a truck, you can put the animals in other stables.

Can you be the first player who fills 5 stables?

Given to the visitors of Spellenspektakel 2014 in Eindhoven, The Netherlands.

168841.description:
Expansion Set for Warage: Starter Set.

This expansion allows an even more balanced multiplayer match and gives more variety to deck building thanks to the new race and class cards.
168841.name: Warage: Covo

168842.description:
Expansion Set for Warage Starter Set.

This expansion expands the cards set and introduces a new game mechanic.
168842.name: Warage: Alchimista

168843.name: Super Smash Bros. The Board Game
168843.description:
Use Nintendo characters to battle opponents using special abilities, items and maneuverability tactics to win the battle. Matches may be timed with a timer or players may use stock number of lives.

Featuring 8 popular Nintendo Smash Bros characters to choose from; Mario, Donkey Kong, Bowser, Link, Pikachu, Fox, Samus, and Kirby!

Each of the characters will have unique special abilities they can perform and that will do damage to opponents just like in the video game. Abilities will do a certain number of damage to an opponent. Once a player’s character has reached damage level of 20 there considered critical. Perform ability 3 to give them a final smash attack to send them flying!

168844.name: Three Kings (Trail of Cthulhu)
168844.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wartime roleplaying…
…with tentacles!

Achtung! Cthulhu brings you a two-fisted wartime TRAIL OF CTHULHU roleplaying game setting packed full of fiendish Nazis, terrifying ancient mysteries, legendary war machines, and enough writhing tentacles to fill ten Reichstags!

Three Kings is the first in a series of standalone adventure supplements in the globe-spanning Zero Point campaign for Achtung! Cthulhu written by Sarah Newton. Join a band of heroic soldiers, agents, and partisans behind enemy lines on the eve of World War Two, as they discover the unspeakable horrors of Castle Karlstein in occupied Czechoslovakia!

Inside you will find everything you need:

A standalone multi-episode adventure for hours of play!
New rules for Trail of Cthulhu wartime investigations
Maps of Europe, Czechoslovakia, Castle Karlstein, and the surrounding area
An “Operational Briefing” handout
Setting information on Nazi-occupied Czechoslovakia
Packed full of inspiration artwork by Dim Martin
Four pregenerated characters to get you playing immediately!

168845.name: Heroes of the Sea (Trail of Cthulhu)
168845.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wartime roleplaying…
…with tentacles!

Achtung! Cthulhu brings you a two-fisted wartime TRAIL OF CTHULHU roleplaying game setting packed full of fiendish Nazis, terrifying ancient mysteries, legendary war machines, and enough writhing tentacles to fill ten Reichstags!

Heroes of the Sea is the second standalone adventure supplement in the globe-spanning Zero Point campaign. Play soldiers, agents, and resistance fighters in the chaos and carnage of the Battle of Dunkirk, as a sinister conspiracy threatens the lives of the retreating Allied forces!

Inside you will find everything you need:

A standalone 69 PAGE multi-episode adventure for several sessions of play!
New rules for Trail of Cthulhu wartime investigations, including tanks and Stukas
17 all-new spells
Maps of Europe and the evacuation at Dunkirk
An “Operational Briefing” and many other beautiful handouts!
Four pre-generated characters to get you playing immediately!

168846.name: Sewer Tunnels
168846.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you're mapping endless sewers, sometimes you just need some simple tunnels and passages. The Sewer Tunnels set is exactly what you want!

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility.

This product includes sixteen unique map tiles rendered at 100px per five-foot square. This set depicts simple sewer tunnels with only minor features. Nothing hidden here, so there are no GM versions of these tiles. This set includes (ST1-ST16):

Four 50x50 foot tiles.
Eight 50x100 foot tiles.
Four 100x100 foot tiles.
A map legend image detailing all map markup.
A one-third scale summary map showing all tiles.
A short readme PDF.




All maps are ready-to-use PNG-format files compatible with most virtual tabletops. Use them as-is, or combine them into larger maps using your favorite image processing software.

168847.name: The Death of Ulfstater
168847.description:
From publisher blurb:

Death of Ulfstater is a story roleplaying game about the death of a Viking King and the actions of his vassals during the traditional week-long mourning. Players take on the roles of the vassals, using the week of mourning to promote their agendas and sully the reputations of the other vassals in a final effort to prove they are the most worthy of sitting on the throne.

As the game progresses, we not only learn what kind of vassals served under Ulfstater, but we also learn what kind of person Ulfstater was as well. In the end, Ulfstater will be set ablaze and the smoke will carry his soul to one of the four Norse afterlifes — Fólkvangr, Hel, Helgafjell, or Valhalla — and a new King (or Queen) will be crowned.

Death of Ulfstater is a competitive game. Characters cannot fight or kill one another during the week of mounring, but everything else is acceptable.

boardgamecompilation: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Critically Wounded Victims
Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Explosive Objects
Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Hazmat POI
Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Heavy Victim
Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Lightly Wounded Victims
Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Locked Doors
Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Veteran and Rescue Dog
Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Victim with Oxygen Tank
168849.description: Flash Point: Fire Rescue - Extreme Danger Kickstarter Bonus Pack is a collection of promos for Flash Point: Fire Rescue given out to backers of the Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Extreme Danger Kickstarter campaign.
168849.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Extreme Danger Kickstarter Bonus Pack

168850.description: The Blocks in the West Card Deck is an expansion for Blocks in the West and consists of 12 Special Events cards (400g, double laminated, UV matted, 3d).
168850.name: Blocks in the West: Card Deck
boardgameaccessory: Blocks in the West: Chrome Expansion

168851.description: The Blocks in Afrika: Card Deck is an expansion for Blocks in Afrika and consists of 12 Special Events cards (400g, double laminated, UV matted, 3d)
168851.name: Blocks in Afrika: Card Deck

168852.description: The EARLY WAR Card Deck is an expansion for the Blocks Series and consists of 12 Special Events cards (400g, double laminated, UV matted, 3d)
168852.name: EARLY WAR Card Deck

168853.description: The Middle War Card Deck is an expansion for the BLOCKS SERIES and consists of 12 Special Events cards (400g, double laminated, UV matted, 3d)
168853.name: MIDDLE WAR Card Deck

168854.description:
The LATE WAR Card Deck is an expansion for the BLOCKS SERIES and includes:


1 card deck, with 12 Special Events cards (400g, double laminated, UV matted, 3d)
168854.name: LATE WAR Card Deck

168855.name: Taudelon Station
168855.description:
Taudelon Station is a game that shares elements with traditional card games and modern economy games. Players will use their hands of cards to create resources and currency so they can build various modules. These modules are worth points at the end of the game and they also modify how the game plays as well. A unique aspect to Taudelon Station is that these modifications change the game for all of the players, not just for the players who own the modules.

Players’ hands come from a deck of cards that has five suits, numbered 1 to 9. Players will either play a combination of at least two cards that equal exactly 10 to create a resource (called Elements), or they will play a combination of cards similar to the various types of Poker hands (pair, full house, etc.) to create the currency (called Energy) that works with the resources to let players build the modules.

Meanwhile, unidentified aliens are swarming around the station, and while the game is fully competitive, the players all must defend the station against the aliens or everyone loses.

168856.name: Opération Nez rouge: Le jeu
168856.description:
In Opération Nez rouge: Le jeu, players form teams of two persons: one driver and one passenger. Each team tries to be the first to get home! The passenger shouldn't snooze! Give the right indications to the driver to ensure to come safe! Driver, you'll try to understand what your funny passenger is telling you.

The game is played in successive rounds. The winning team will be the first one to complete three itineraries. One player picks up an itinerary card and will try to give indications by funny words and gesture. The other player (driver) will have to switch cards displayed in front of him to replicate the right itinerary of the objective card.

168857.name: The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Wrench
168857.description:
Wrench is a kobold artificer who has always been interested in gadgets and engineering. His voracious appetite for learning led him to the writings of Wizgille the Tinkerer, and eventually, to study with Wizgille herself.

*The Good: He can quickly build gizmos that can do amazing things.
*The Bad: Those gizmos are very fragile!

The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Wrench expands the party at the Red Dragon Inn with an ingenious kobold whose gizmo cards stick around to help him out on later turns! Those gizmos will gradually break down, though, and the other players at the table can cause them to break down even faster!

The Red Dragon Inn: Allies is a series of expansions for any standalone The Red Dragon Inn game. Each Allies set includes a single Character Deck, plus components to add a brand new character to your game.

168858.name: RPM Street
168858.description:
A street racing deck-building game.

Each player gets a unique vehicle with varying strengths and weaknesses.

Each round, players will try to have more power than their opponents so as to get a better trophy. However, they must simultaneously strive to have sufficient handling in order to avoid taking damage, which not only saturates your deck with useless cards, but also decreases your overall score.

Once one of the three trophy card stacks (Bronze, Silver, and Gold) is depleted, the game ends. Players count their total score from their trophies and then subtract one for each damage card in their deck. Whoever has the highest score wins!

168859.name: Mulligan's Wild
168859.description:
From the box:

Object of the game: Move all the tees from the tee box to the green. Don't forget this is an exciting, strategy game with lakes, sand traps and obstacles. So get your golfers together and have fun.

User Description:
Mulligan's Wild is a golf-themed roll-and-move game with a "send your opponent back to the start" mechanic similar to Backgammon or Sorry. Although this game claims to be "Golf game of the year," the golf theme seems entirely pasted on. Players roll dice and try to move their pieces (or "tees") out of their tee box, along the track, to their green and then into their hole. There is a special "Mulligan's Wild" die included, which allows players to move a number of spaces of their choice. First player to move all tees onto the matching green and into the matching hole wins.

168860.name: Tiki Challenge
168860.description:
"Get ready for adventure as you cross a deep chasm on rickety swinging bridges! The trail to the tiki is easy to follow if you know how to use blends and digraphs--but watch out for broken boards!"

Tiki Challenge is an educational game to teach children words using blends and digraphs. Players have a series of tiles displaying blends and digraphs. Each player spins a spinner, moves along a track to a space with a partial word, and must use a tile from his/her hand to complete the word. A player who is unable to complete a word must return to the start. The first player to reach the tiki at the end of the track wins.

168861.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 15 No 4 - May 2012)
168861.description: In this issue: Conventions, Tabletop Games, Blog Posts, Forum Discussions, Automotive Combat Fiction, Computer Games, and Autoduelling Technology Today.

168862.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 16 No 1 - March 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Car Wars Fifth Edition Items on e23
Car Wars News from The Daily Illuminator

boardgamehonor: 2015 SXSW Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
168863.description: Cadence is a 2 player biking microgame in which players are professional cycle racers going head to head on a race circuit. Racers use their stamina, shift gears, make use of abilities like 'drafting' and 'sprinting' and strive to reach to the finish line first. The game makes use of unique mechanics like card interlocking, sliding and rotating cards, 3D like vertically folded racer cards to fit a fairly complex but tactical game in just 18 cards. The race is played on a track made up of 6 'track cards' which are either flat sections or climbs and descends of different gradients. Double sided track cards allow for a second more difficult track to be made from the backs of the cards giving replay ability to the game. There are 2 racers to chose from while they each have their own special abilities the other one does not have. You can play a big game of 3 laps or a short filler of 1 lap, so immerse yourself in the world of bike racing, micro style!
168863.name: Cadence: Road Racing Championship

168864.name: Elements: Soul of Fire
168864.description:
The light of the world fades. Evil hearts seek the Power of the Elements - the forces which bind the universe together - thus threatening all of existence.
Join an eclectic cast of characters and embark on a fantastic journey in the vast archipelago of Adamaria, evoking the gods of the land, sea, and sky in your quest to rekindle the fire of hope! Restore the light to the mystical Runes by earning the favor of the mighty Elemental Guardians and stand up to the oppressive forces of darkness.
From the depths of the ocean to the highest skies and far, far beyond, your journey will take you to unimaginable places. Breathtaking action, mind-bending puzzles, and perilous traps await you in this epic 70-hour adventure.
Come, awaken the power within YOU! Lose yourself in "Elements: Soul of Fire!"

Source: The Developer Website.

168865.name: Lylian Episode One: Paranoid Friendship
168865.description:
You play as Lylian, a patient in the Hacklaster Hospital's children ward.

She has the uncanny ability to spew forth figments of her mind into to the "real" world. And cause damage with the long sleeves of her straitjacket.

Source: The Game Website.

168866.name: Platypus II
168866.description:
Fly the famed Platypus fighter through a fantastic landscape of carefully molded clay to protect inhabitants of Mungola from the Collosatropolians! Collect power-ups and bonus stars to give your Platypus the boost you need. Every level of this gorgeous arcade challenge bursts with original fun that's perfect for gamers of all ages.

Source: The Developer Website.

168867.name: Nux
168867.description:
You are NUX, sole survivor of the Nexon warrior tribe. The evil Silthax hasinvaded your home world of Nexolus, devoured your fellow Nexons and stolenthe sacred power crystals from your village.

Legend states that these crystals contain the power of life itself, and haveprotected your people for an eternity. They may even have the power to reversethe damage that the Silthax has done.

With your home in ruins and only your ship and your trusty blaster to protectyou, here begins your final mission. Hunt down this vile creature, rid thegalaxy of its evil and recover the power crystals!

Features


3 fun-filled game modes
Shoot, fly & explore on foot
Amazing claymation graphics
4 planets to explore
13 Action-packed levels


Source: The Developer Website.

168868.name: Flatten out Monsters
168868.description:
Monsters invade! Heroes are ready to defend in groups of two, but these heroes are out of control and need an intelligent leader to lead them to victory. Can you do it?

Flatten out Monsters is a new type of memory game in which you need to memorize only six cards! Can you effectively lead the heroes and flatten out the monsters?

To set up, monster cards are placed in a 3x7 grid and double-sided hero cards are placed in a 3x2 grid in front of the monsters. Heroes in the same line — that is, a line of two hero cards — will fight the seven monsters lined in front of them. On a player's turn, he must swap two hero cards, then flip them to the reverse sides. These two cards activate the cards in the same line with them and become the attacking groups, then you resolve the attack on the monsters one by one in each activated line. If the two hero cards show the icons needed to defeat the first monster in line, they win the fight and score the monster card. Then they fight against the second monster, and so on until they fail. Play continues in clockwise order until at least two lines of monsters are all defeated, and whoever has the most monster cards wins!

168869.name: Micro Train
168869.description:
It is your job to help connect coaches to the train. You are not only responsible for adding coaches of the colour assigned to you, but to also complete the train as quickly as possible.

A short train building game for two, consisting of only 19 cards. The winner of the game is the person with the most valuable coach segment in the color they are responsible for. Train coaches are worth different points based on their class, and coaches can only be added to coaches on the train if they have the same class or colour, where first class passenger coaches cannot be added directly to third class coaches, and vice versa.

Players face a simple choice on each turn: Take a train coach card in their hand, or add a coach coach from their hand to the train. But beware - coaches not placed at the end of the game counts against your score.

168870.name: Relic Knights: One Shot
168870.description:
One Shot is aptly named. It is said her relic's massive Goliath Cannon can bring down a starship. It is a theory that few enemy commanders are willing to test. One Shot combines her devastating fire power with an unmatched skill commanding her troops, guiding their fire into the enemy ranks with surgical precision.

Gifted with rare and mighty gifts, Relic Knights are the ultimate leaders for your cadres. More than just powerful game pieces, these stunning models are beautiful centerpieces for your miniature collection!

168871.name: Relic Knights: Sophia Drake
168871.description: Sophia Drake grew up among the mercenaries of the Galactic Merchants' Guild, so it was no surprise that she would join Black Diamond as soon as she was of age. Now she commands Black Diamond's elite heavy infantry division, the Black Dragons, and seeks to restore Black Diamond and GAMA to its former glory.

168872.name: Flowering Snail
168872.description:
Flowering Snail is a refreshing abstract game that challenges players to plan ahead over the two stages of the game! Players compete against each other by increasing their snail population. You need to place your snail cards and flower cards wisely to claim the delicious flowers (for the snails, of course), and maintain your snail population to score the most points!

The game is played in two phases: Multiplication and Die Out phases. In the Multiplication phase, players alternates to place their Snail cards (with values 1 to 3) onto the game board adjacent to other snails already there. As an additional action, they may also place one Flower card onto the game board. After all Snail and Flower cards are placed, players check who controls each Flower cards by adding the values on their Snail cards. The higher sum may take the adjacent Flower card as scores.

In Die Out phase, players alternate to remove Snails cards from the game board if the chosen Snail card has a lower value than all the other adjacent Snail cards, until no more Snail cards can be removed. Each remaining Snail card scores the printed value for its owner, and each Flower cards worths 2 VP. The player with higher VP wins the games.

168873.name: Castles and Keeps
168873.description:
Castles and Keeps is a 2 player head to head card laying game using a deck of only 9 cards.

On each card there are four castles which contain a different combination of player shields.

Players take turns to place a card matching the castle type and at the same time trying to cover their opponents shields with their own.

Once all cards have been placed, players with three or more castles connected by a road score one point for each.

As soon as a player gets to 30 points they are crowned the champion.

Castles and Keeps is a free print and play game.

168874.name: Nakama
168874.description:
Nakama is a furious pixel powered ninja beat ‘em up.

Features:
Story Mode and Endless Mode
Game Menu is part of the world
Cute Pixel Art
Rescue the Nakama (buddies) that will help you in your quest!
Lots of Parallax!
iOS7 Game Controller Support
Game Center Achievements

Source: The Developer Website.

168875.name: Monkey Boxing
168875.description:
Enter the Monkey Boxing League with Monkey Boxing! Step inside the ring, do powerful K.O.s and combos, customize your monkey, and compete for HUGE Trophies!

Features:
• High quality 3d Graphics: Fully animated 3D characters with dynamic accurate lighting.
• Funny to Play: Ludicrous characters and fast paced, crazy gameplay.
• Customization: Create your own Monkey Boxer choosing colors and wearable props up to more than 269 BILLIONS of combinations.
• Unlockable Items: Win new wearable props beating loudicrous “famous” monkey boxers.
• Addictive Gameplay: Challenge yourself and others to get the best score on infinite game levels.
• Training: Train your monkey to get best boxing performances.
• Lots of Levels: Win the WMB Cup playing the first 50 levels and then continue fighting for an unlimited number of matches.
• 2 Players Option: Challenge a friend on the same device.
• Gamecenter Leaderboards and lots of Achievements!

Source: The Developer Website.

168876.name: Dig!
168876.description:
A homage to the 80’s game QiX, you play the role of a not so great archeologist working for a failing museum. You must collect artifacts to save your job, unfortunately you are also cursed by a mummy. Featuring many zones to unearth with hats to wear that grant you unique perks and awesome power ups to use. But beware the vast selection of enemies that have nothing better to do than stop your archeological quest.

Source: The Developer Website.

168877.name: Topia World Builder
168877.description:
From the Award Winning Studio Crescent Moon Games and Glenn Corpes, one of the creators of the original Populous series of games, comes TOPIA WORLD BUILDER, a unique world building sim, tailored for iOS devices.

Topia World Builder is a world creation simulation. You become god and shape the land as you choose, by the use of touch controls. Swipe your finger to create mountains, valleys, rivers, and oceans. Watch trees grow, spawn thousands of animals – and watch them live and die on the planet of your creation!

Features:
-Create Mountains
-Create Valleys
-Create Rivers
-Create Oceans
-Spawn various animal types
-Build enormous herds of animals
-Watch predators attack other animals
-Save your worlds so you can edit them later
-Change the color of land, water, sky
-Play in both landscape and portrait modes

Source: The Developer Website.

168878.name: Slingshot Racing
168878.description:
Slingshot Racing is an original racing game developed exclusively for touchscreen devices.

Behold a beautiful steampunk environment with ice tracks, grappling hooks, snowmen and more! Use your grappling hook to slingshot around corners in this fast paced arcade style racer. Hone your skills by learning on the tutorial tracks, then blast out of the snow onto more complex tracks against other racers. Race around a selection of tracks in stunning day and night settings.

Career mode features 80 races with different objectives and settings. Take part in a simple straight race to the top spot on the podium. The pickups race pits you against the clock to collect all the cogs on the track as quickly as possible. The time trials offer you the chance to shave all important seconds and compare your times with others on the Game Center leaderboards*. Alternatively prove your mettle by taking on the fearsome chomper as it hunts you around the track.

With 4 way multiplayer you can race family or friends on just a single device or through Game Center**. With just a few clicks you can create mini tournaments the way you like or just mix it up with a quick random selection.

FEATURES
• Super addictive gameplay
• Revolutionary controls, easy to pickup and difficult to master
• Stunning graphics with gorgeous 3d effects, shadows, and particle systems
• 4 player simultaneous play on one device! Play against your whole family!
• Tweet or Post your high scores on Facebook
• Game Center Leaderboards and Achievements*
• 4 player online tournaments through Game Center**
• iCloud supported so your game progress is available on all your devices*


iOS only feature
iOS 5 or over only feature



Source: The Developer Website.

168879.name: Xenolith
168879.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




The fast paced arcade smash 'em up. Match the shape of your Xenolith opponents to safely smash through them.

Xenolith is a high skill game designed to be hard but fair with well balanced levels that allow you to develop your skills without frustration. Highly responsive controls allow you to move and aim your ship with precision. Multiple enemy classes and game modes will test every aspect of these skills.

Set on a mysterious primordial world with beautiful crystalline structures, the game features elegant stylised graphics and particle effects.

Key Features
• Shape matching mechanics
• Variety of beautiful combat arenas
• Multiple enemy classes
• Different game modes
• Leaderboards
• Full controller support

Source: The Developer Website.

168880.name: Razor: Salvation
168880.description:
As commander of the dropship 'Salvation', you are tasked with rescuing Earth's inhabitants and helping with the EDSF defence effort.

Razor Salvation is the first instalment in a series of games that will take the player along the story of the Xenos and why they have invaded our planet Earth.
Features
• DYNAMIC COVER-BASED AI - Enemies exhibit different strategies and duck in and out of cover. Dynamic objects can be blasted around the level and the enemy will continue to find cover behind them! Shoot the Xenos, protect the civilians! Or leave them alone and watch the infected eat them...
• FIRST PERSON "BEACH HEAD" DEFENCE - Use the classic FPS weapons like grenade launcher, rocket launcher and railgun. Access to awesome specials like the Redeemer!
• IPAD 3 RETINA - Full 2048 x 1536 resolution real-time 3D and 2D UI graphics.
• CONSOLE GRADE GRAPHICS - Specular bump mapped textures and full-screen pixel effects for all devices down to iPhone 3GS.
• PLAYER CREATED FACTIONS - Create your own factions with friends and fight together to be the top performing Faction in the world!
• FIGHT FOR YOUR REGION - Help your world region to the top of the rankings!
• UNIQUE LEADERBOARD TITLES - Be the best shooter or savior and show off with the ability to be at the top!

Source: The Developer Website.

168881.name: Qbism HD
168881.description:
Qbism HD is a unique and challenging 3D puzzle game like no other! Slide the cubes into the outline to solve the puzzle. Sound simple enough? It is, so we added a 3rd dimension. Now the challenge is on! Challenge your perception and solve Qbism HD!

FEATURES
• Universal HD Edition (hi-res 3D graphics, Hollywood-style Bloom and 4x anti-aliasing on iPad 2!)
• 2 themes (switchable in options)
• Cute kitten option
• Over 150 puzzles to solve
• User-friendly touch controls, including zoom!
• Supports Apple Game Centre
• In game Statistics - best times, moves and rotations
• 5 sizes of game play ( 3x3x3, 4x4x4, 5x5x5, 6x6x6, MonstR )
• Music by Robot Science

HOW TO PLAY
Playing Qbism is simple!
The aim is to slide all the cubes back into the outline, from all angles. Slide the cubes into the outline by swiping the selected cube up, down, left or right. Stars will appear when a cube is placed correctly. You can rotate the puzzle outline by swiping up, down, left or right in the empty space. Once the puzzle is solved, swipe the puzzle any direction to reveal it's complete shape.

Source: The Developer Website.

168882.description:
Ahoy, adventurer! The Arctic is merciless: Your expedition team has to endure the unforgiving wilderness, the unexpected weather and the other fame hungry teams. Only one will be remembered as the conqueror of the North Pole. If you think you can adapt the ever-changing harsh conditions better than the others, start gearing up — the race is on!

In Race to the North Pole each player has an expedition team which they have to navigate to the North Pole on the middle of the game board. The first player to get all of his or her pawns there wins the game. Game is played by moving with cards that are in front of you. Some cards allow movement while others also ambushing other players. But ambushing has a price! When ever you tackle another player you have to grab an "Ice Mask Tile", which include equipment and some nasty hazards that might ruin your well planned schemes.

Race to the North Pole also features a unique rotating board that simulates the Arctic weather. When a storm hits the board, everything changes! Your movement cards travel on the board and you receive a new set, the arctic maze that is formed out of cracks changes completely and the players travel around the board with the weather. This design has deep strategical elements that make every playthrough exciting and challenging to the very end.

The game includes a free app Dized that gives players loads of new content, localizations, and mechanisms to use with the game through their smart devices.
168882.name: Race to the North Pole
boardgameaccessory: Race to the North Pole: Second Edition Pawn Set

168883.name: Gunscape
168883.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.





Create, play and share your own FPS experiences. Mash-up your favourite classics into something amazing!What makes Gunscape different from typical FPS games is that the players create the gameplay. Inspired by the first-person shooters of the past that we loved, we're taking all the most memorable elements and putting them in a toolkit to be used and combined however you want. At its heart, Gunscape is an FPS construction kit. It's a game that lets you go wild with your creativity in a pumping action sandbox! Gunscape does this by providing easy-to-use tools based on a block-placement interface everybody's already familiar with to create single-player campaigns, co-op maps and multiplayer arenas and the functionality to share your creations with your friends. Don't like building stuff and just want to blast your way through hordes of monsters or duel with other players? Maps can also be shared, played and voted on by the whole world, so you'll always have new levels at your fingertips!

Game Features
• Solo and online co-operative multiplayer level creation! Build maps at your own pace or invite friends to help out! Jump in and out of action mode while editing to test your level on the fly or just to blast one another.
• Single-player campaign mode: play or create a sequence or branching tree of levels with or without a story. Build a whole self-contained adventure or a gauntlet of fearsome challenges.
• Co-op mode: invite one or more friends to tackle a dedicated co-op map with you or take a single-player map and crank up the difficulty.
• Multiplayer arenas: build a map with multiple spawn points and powerups and invite your friends or host a public game for some brutal online action using one of many multiplayer modes, including classics such as free-for-all and team deathmatch, capture the flag variants, king of the hill and domination/point capture modes and different tag/infection variants. We plan on including a lot of these, and to continue adding more, including flexible objectives like race to the finish which could be used to build multiplayer rocket jump courses or other types of challenge maps such as a competitive adventure through trap-filled dungeons, or hunter which awards points for killing monsters so you can create your own MP dinosaur safari.
• Cross-platform multiplayer: optional where it counts, but great to have for cross-platform co-op!
• Global and persistent map sharing: anyone can play the levels you share regardless of platform (votes are recorded and can be displayed per-platform, just in case).
• 8+ themes by the time we go to open beta.
• 38+ weapons @ open beta.
• 16+ player avatars @ open beta.
• 20+ enemies @ open beta.
• 4+ multiplayer match modes @ open beta, probably more!

Source: The Game Website.

168884.name: Alien: Isolation – Last Survivor
168884.description:
User Summary

This is a DLC for the game Alien: Isolation. The DLC featuring the last scene in the movie Alien as gameplay. As Ripley the player has to set off the self-destruct sequence and escape in the shuttle.

168885.name: Alien: Isolation – Corporate Lockdown
168885.description:
User Summary

Corporate Lockdown is the 1st add-on for the game Alien: Isolation, expanding the Sevastopol's story, taking place some days before Amanda Ripley arrives, making it a prequel.

The story is about Seegson Executive Ransome that is trying to escape the ship, taking decoded Nostromo data with him. The aim is to stop him. The game adds three new challenge levels: Severance, Scorched Earth and Loose Ends.

The add-on also introduce Gauntlet mode, there the player can try to complete all three survivor challenges in a row without dying.

168886.name: Elegia
168886.description:
from the Introduction:
…each short campaign played with the Elegia rules should feel like its own separate game, as self-contained as any old video game cartridge. This may very well be the first RPG that seriously and explicitly sets out to capture for the tabletop the unique feel of retro console RPGs like Ultima, Final Fantasy, Dragon Warrior, and others. To wit, Elegia is very much a game of combat and
exploration, albeit in a simplified and abstracted sort of way. If you have come here looking for a dramatic narrative, you are in the wrong place. But neither is this game particularly “old school”, in the sense that players are expected to equip themselves realistically for an expedition, counting rope and rations and torches and henchmen, and then go searching every hexagon on the map for tombs and ruins to loot. If you have come here looking for a swords-and-sorcery sandbox to play in, you also are in the wrong place! Elegia is for players who want to wander around a world map, encounter random monsters, grind for gold and “level-ups”, exchange key items for plot points, and take the battle all the way to the “final boss”.

user comment:
Elegia is the precursor to, or an early edition of, Retro Phaze.

from the Introduction to Retro Phaze
Retro Phaze is a revision of Elegia, a new edition of the game with more than just the title getting a facelift. Excessive play-testing of the original game revealed its weakness, its imbalances, and its warts—those clunky little bits of inelegance which could use some smoothing over to make the game play better at the table. The upshot: Retro Phaze is not a thought experiment or an exercise in armchair RPG design. It is meant to be played. In the hands of a group that knows well and wants to embrace the tropes, modes, and clichés so lovingly reproduced here, it’s fun. You’ll find no false modesty here: when done right, this game is really fun!

168887.name: 10 Paladin Magic Items
168887.description:
From publisher blurb:

Equipment as heroic as you are!

Sometimes you want to sit down to a full meal of archetypes, base classes, feats, magic items, npcs, prestige classes, traits, classes, or spells, and sometime you just want a cheap, quick, and easy snack. To feed your craving Rite Publishing presents the “10 Series” which will presents 10 pieces for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

This time out we bring you 10 new magical items to supplement the Paladin.

Harm’s Way armor and shield special ability: put yourself between those who need to be protected and those who would seek them harm.
Patience weapon special ability: inflict more damage if your allies don’t start the fight.
Boots of the Brave: Be the first to kick in the door, help allies flee while you cover their retreat, or plant your feet so no one gets by you.
Bracers of Heroic Deeds: Move instantly so you can catch someone falling, instantly change places with the hurt or helpless, or take all the damage upon yourself from an area attack.
Gauntlets of Remand: Put the helpless, the captured, injured allies, or dangerous foes into an extradimensional stasis from which you can recover them later. .
Heavenly Helm: turn your paladin’s lay on hands into a targeted gaze attack.
Ring of Honor’s Justice: immediately bestow curses upon those who use cowardly forms of attack against you.
Tabard of Righteous Metamagic: Make it easier to enhance your lawful and good spells with metamagic feats
Vestments of Honor’s Virtue: your paladin gains a defensive enhancement when you perform honorable acts.
Harngaul “The Righteous Storm” Legacy Item: Let your magic item level up with you, and provide you with the ultimate tool for justice!

168888.name: Shadowrun: Crossfire – Oni Promo Card
168888.description: An additional Shadowrun: Crossfire character card included with pre-ordered base sets. Oni is basically an ork character with Oni Evolution sticker and 5 Karma printed on the sheet. It also features a race-specific art and description.

168889.name: Shadowrun: Crossfire – Harlequin's Shadow Promo Card
168889.description: Harlequin's Shadow is a promo Crossfire Deck card given out during GenCon 2014. It is used in Close The Portal scenario available for download from Catalyst Game Labs website.

168890.description:
This expansion comes with one new ship and contains ship cards, captains, and tokens necessary for use in "Star Trek: Attack Wing".

The oversized borg cube measures an impressive 8 inches on each facing.

Contents:
1 Cube 112 / Borg Starship Pre-painted Miniature
1 Plastic Base
32 Tokens
1 Maneuver Dial
2 Ship Cards
- Cube 112
- Borg Starship
1 Maneuver Card
- Borg Cube
2 Captain Cards
- Locutus
- Drone
3 Additional Rules Cards
2 Mission Cards
- The Battle of Wolf 359: Mission Overview
- The Battle of Wolf 359: Special Rules
168890.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Cube 112 Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

boardgameimplementation: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Deep Space 9 Expansion Pack
168891.description:
The gateway between the Alpha and Gamma Quadrants, Deep Space 9 is a pivotal and strategic Federation space station.

The retail variant of the Deep Space Nine Expansion pack differs from Star Trek: Attack Wing – Deep Space 9 Expansion Pack, featuring an all-new premium paint job and new stats.

Included are the GenCon Star Trek: Attack Wing – DS9 Upgrade Card Pack, two ship cards, a maneuver dial, and all necessary tokens for gameplay.
168891.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Deep Space Nine Expansion Pack (Retail Variant)
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

168892.description:
Sunrise City: Nights!, the first full expansion for this much loved game. Isaias Vallejo, the designer, set out to bring a little bit of the night-life and casino flavor to the base game and to add a couple of fun mechanics to what many have called a "New Classic" board game.

The Sunrise City: Nights! expansion gives you more of what you love most in the base game.

The 16 new Role Cards give you more customizable player powers and more options for bending the rules to your advantage.
Two new meeple Roles have a familiar feel but their ability to roam through the city gives you new options to block your opponents.




The silver Benchmark Tokens are worth 5pts each so you'll never run out of stars.

Nights! also introduces two new game systems to enhance the game and add a casino-feel to your city-building adventure.

Each player starts the game with a set of five special One-Zone Building (OZB) Tiles that they can play over the course of the game. They play just like any other Building Tile but their size lets them fill in isolated zones or fit neatly onto the edge of a growing skyscraper. OZBs also present new scoring methods based on the current configuration of the city so their potential effect on your score and the city itself, is different each time they're played.
The Fortune Die is a six-sided die with the red, green, blue and yellow on four sides and purple on two sides. Certain Role Cards and new Building Tiles use the Fortune Die to create a casino-feel with probability-base rewards.
168892.name: Sunrise City: Nights!

168893.name: Engines & Empires Character Sheets and Maps pack
168893.description:
from the back cover
This indispensable accessory contains a variety of character sheet designs, some simple and some elaborate, all for use with your E&E game. Also included are maps taken from the World of Gaia campaign setting, all in one convenient download. Pick your favorite style of character sheet and print it as often as you need to! Keep the maps handy at your game table!

168894.name: It's a Cinch
168894.description:
Described by the publisher as a "multiplication and division poker game," It's a Cinch is an educational game designed to teach multiplication tables. Three stacks of poker-style chips with answers to multiplication tables printed on them are placed in the center of the table. Each player is dealt five cards with single-digit numbers. Each player in turn tries to find two cards in their hand that can be multiplied to match the total on one of the three top chips. The player then captures that chip, discards the two played cards, and draws two new cards. They player may then try to capture another chip (up to three per turn). When the player reaches three chips or cannot capture another chip, play passes to the next player. If a player makes a mistake and plays the wrong cards to capture a chip, the player must put both that chip and one previously-captured chip on the bottom of one stack and pass his turn. After all the chips are claimed, the player with the most chips wins.

There are a couple of variants which add extra rules, as well as a solitaire version.

168895.description:
Corrupted Kingdoms is a fun strategy and negotiation game set in a fantasy world, where you take on the role of an evil corporate monster, fighting for power over the pathetic united kingdoms and its political elite. To advance your hidden agenda, and enrich the lives of your friends and associates, you will use your horde of minions to corrupt and subvert the assembly of the realm. Use the right kinds of "persuasion", increase your own power, and push backroom deals through the assembly, all while looting the kingdom and its people of all its worth.

At the start of the game, each player will choose a fantasy corporation to play as (Dragons, Sorcerers, Giants, Witches, Vampires or Orcs), a Hidden Agenda which will guide their evil plan, and some starting minions (Zombies, Demons, Goblins, or Golems).

Over the course of the game players will influence the assembly of the realm (Humans, Elves, Dwarves, and Gnomes) using their minions and influence. Propose bills through lobbying efforts, buy useless and pretty luxuries, and get the politicians who represent the (ahem) "people" to push their nefarious legislation into law.
168895.name: Corrupted Kingdoms
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 196

168896.name: Quizmo Vocabulary
168896.description: Educational game of bingo to teach antonyms and synonyms. Cards are laid out just like a bingo game (5 x 5 grid), but the "free" space is labeled either as "antonyms" or "synonyms". The rest of the spaces are words. The game leader pick a word from the 121-calling card deck and call it out. Those players with "antonym" on their free space will cover any word that is an antonym of the called word. Those players with "synonym" on their free space will cover any word that is a synonym of the called word. Any player who covers 5 spaces in one row of their card - either vertically, horizontally or diagonally, will call out "Quizmo!". They are the winner of that game.

168897.name: Sword Art Online: Lost Song
videogamehonor: 2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Gal of the Year Nominee
168897.description:
User Summary

Sword Art Online: Lost Song is set in the world of ALfheim Online and features the ability to fly and battle huge monsters.

168899.description: Against the background of the history of the City of Lokeren (a city in Flanders, Belgium) players try to acquire local products (pigs, hares, hats, linseed, corn, turnips) and sell them on the market. With profits made on the market players can construct buildings or improve their modes of transport (cart, horse and cart, truck). In the meantime players can obtain title deeds and chance cards which are worth victory points. The one with the most victory points at the end of the game wins.
168899.name: De Schout van Lokeren

168900.name: D. Afonso Henriques
168900.description:
D. Afonso Henriques is a game about the first King of Portugal. During the game, each player will follow the King through several villages in order to recruit the best army. When in battle, each player will use it’s army to fight and defeat the Moors and hence contribute to the victory of the Portuguese.

The players recruit the armies when D. Afonso Henriques meeple is in a circle over a small village in the Portugal’s map. Respecting order of play, each player chooses the village he wants to go, in the villages area in the board, and places his cylinder in the available symbol.

Players can enter a battle when D. Afonso Henriques meeple is in the circles marked as battle. In it’s turn, the player chooses one or more Portuguese cards from his hand to enter the fight. He places his chosen card(s) face up in the battle field, in one of the 4 spots available, in front of the Moors card that he wants to fight with. Each Portuguese card indicates in it’s lower side the number of dice that the player is allowed to roll. If a Player uses 2 cards, he can roll the total dices resulting from the 2 cards. Each Moors card has in it’s upper right corner a die with a value. If the highest result of any dice rolled by a player matches or is superior to this value, the player wins the fight and the Moors card is defeated.

The game ends after the battle of Ourique (the 5th battle). The player with more Victory Points wins the game.

168901.name: Tianxia: Path of Destiny
168901.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tianxia: Path of Destiny is a Lifepath Generator for Tianxia: Blood, Silk & Jade!

This PDF acts as an Appendix to the Kung Fu fantasy setting outlined in Tianxia: Blood, Silk & Jade, and can help you jump-start character creation. Presented as equal parts random tables and character creation workshop, Jack Norris's Path of Destiny will help you discover new characters with a roll of the dice!

Easy-to-use tables will help you quickly choose aspects, skill assignments, and background elements for your characters. Sidebars and expanded explanations throughout will help you expand on the ideas sparked by the tables! You can roll or pick your way through the tables, too, there's no "Good" or "Bad" options, characters built this way will not wind up more or less powerful than characters built using the guidelines in the Tianxia core book.

168902.name: Campaign Chunks Volume Four
168902.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Campaign Chunk is an item, place or something else that can fit into any campaign or story with little or no modification, although some will be more suited to certain genres than others.

They have few stats and can help provide starting grounds for adventures or help fill in the gaps when your players go off exploring and you need something for them to do. Each has several hooks or rumour that can be used. Which of these are true and which are false?

Originally first published on the blog/website of Ennead Games, these Chunks have been compiled into a handy volume. Their details may have been cleaned up and more hooks or rumours added to them, but they basically the same.

This edition features the following chunks:

Aquatic Antenna - A sponge/coral hybrid unlike anything else known.
Burning Men - An outbreak of Spontaneous human combustion
Damocles class super carrier - A new carrier bigger and more powerful than anything before
Emperor's Delight - A distinct and fruity red wine is proving to very popular
Gastroenteritis Outbreak - An outbreak of infectious diarrhoea
Human Magnets - Living beings who can stick metal objects to themselves
Lines of Falcona - A series of lines carved into the hardened earth
Star Jelly of Hemcus - Greyish-white gelatine like substance that falls from the skies
Thunder Cannons of Calmview - The lake town of Calmview is home to a very odd and regular sound
Vaults of Dunfur - Odd events are occuring at the Dunfur family vaults

168903.name: Evening Session Map Set #08
168903.description:
From publisher blurb:

Evening Session Map #08 consists of maps and handouts of pirates hideout

The set consists of:

a realm map;
a location map (map of a small pirates village);
a one village drawing;
a magic compass drawing;

168904.name: Jumpy
168904.description: Turn the card and try to locate the right animal character on the game board - if there is one! You receive a card for each victory and the player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

168905.name: Twinny
168905.description: Find the same picture on two different cards and mark them with your token. The player who collects the most cards this way wins the game.

168906.description:
Roll the dice to find out your animal colour combination, and try to find it among the tiles which are spread on the table. Once you find your tile, mark it for yourself and move closer to victory. The winner is the one who first is able to place all of his markers.
Contains three different game versions. A fun game to test the speed of the players' reactions. Comes with great, colourful game parts.
168906.name: Bugsy

168908.name: Luriani
168908.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Luriani are a race of contradictions. Most outsiders are struck by the extreme level of politeness in their society and apparent calm demeanour, only to be shocked by a sudden outburst of passion. They are a people with no significant martial tradition that have fought some of the most brutal wars in history. They are loyal Imperial citizens that suddenly and seemingly without warning came to the brink of revolt. These apparent contradictions are the root cause of the Luriani's reputation as emotionally unstable and unpredictable. Yet all these make perfect sense to the Luriani themselves.

This book, the first in the Minor Alien Module series, explores the Luriani, detailing their history, society, physiology and technology. Players will enjoy creating Luriani characters and flying Luriani ships, while referees will have access an entirely new civilisation for their games.

168909.name: Joepspel
168909.description:
This is a smart pack of cards that includes multiple games in one. Each card shows a number, with different symbols and colours to denote how that number can be achieved. For example, the card for 18 shows a red heart (the game's symbol for 2) and a yellow cat (the symbol for 9), a red and yellow pattern, and eighteen dots arranged in a 2x9 grid.

New games playable with the pack appear regularly on the website. The base game is a game that helps to learn multiplication tables while playing the game.

168910.description:
Package of extra plates for Lotto

these plates were produced for Tal Lotteri (Palet Danish edition 1960s)
168910.name: Lotto: Extra plates

168911.name: Order of the White Hand
168911.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement introduces a new Order for goblinoid races and Hobgoblin Samurai and Wolf mount.

Those who follow the Order of the White Hand seek the utter desolation and enslavement of all non goblinoid races. Those who embrace the order follow the path of the cavalier or samurai and seek out to impose the goals and ideals of the Order to their kin.

The Order is detailed and the stat blocks for a hobgoblin samurai and mount are given starting at level 1 and every odd level through 11 and then level 15.

168912.name: Medieval Morgue
168912.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 227th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a dark and foreboding medieval morgue.

The map is 14 x 20 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 4 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2880x2016 pixels in size at 144dpi.

168913.name: Kul genom Sverige
168913.description:
Travel through Sweden to become the first to reach the goal, and thereby win the game.
But be carefull! Landing on an orange spot can be good or bad news for you (move to another place or wait some turns). And if you land on a red place you take one of the 24 Chance cards - this is the same as an orange, but more random.

An exciting drive through Sweden, with a lot of local informations. Family game - also for the little ones.

168914.name: Sjov Gennem Danmark
168914.description:
Travel through Denmark to become the first to reach the goal and thereby be declared the winner.
But be carefull! Landing on an orange spot can be good or bad news for you (move to another place or wait some turns). If you land on a red place you take one of the 24 Chance cards, which is random and unforseen; it could be good - but it could also be bad!.

An exciting drive through Denmark. Family game also for the little ones.

168915.name: As Tears Go By: Operation Starlite
168915.description:
As Tears Go By: Operation Starlite is an introductory level game on the battles of US Marines and the NLF in I Corps of Vietnam in August of 1965.

The Battles of Operation Starlite were the first large-scale fights waged by the Marine Corps in Vietnam. A spy informed the South Vietnamese I Corps commander that an attack on the US Marine Base at Chu Lai by the NLF’s (National Liberation Front) 1st Regiment was imminent. The Marine’s commander, Lt. General Lewis W. Walt convinced his superiors that the best defense was a pre-emptive attack. He also decided against informing or working with his South Vietnamese counterpart, as past intelligence leaks led to the elusive Viet Cong disappearing in the face of the American’s probes and attacks.

Operation Starlite depended upon the coordination of amphibious landed troops of the Marine’s 3/3 Battalion while those of the 1/7 marched from the north to serve as the “anvil”. The “hammer blows” would be delivered by artillery, air and naval support strikes, as well as the 2/4 battalion that would be airlifted into battle. It was hoped that surrounding the VC with multiple threats would trap and force them to do battle.

rpgitemversion: Looking For Group RPG Boxed Set
168916.name: Looking For Group RPG
168916.description:
From the back of the box:

"You all saw it - That orphanage attacked me"

Yells Richard, the undead Warlock; while running from some pretty disapproving nuns.

That's only the beginning.

The Looking For Group Roleplaying Game Boxed Set has all the action you'd expecte and all the laughs of the funniest fantasy satire on the internet. It does to fantasy RPGs what the Looking For Group comic (lfgcomic.com) has done to everything sacred in popular fantasy and science fiction for years; it tears it down and uses the pieces to pave a road to legitimate high fantasy.


What’s in the Box?

Everything you need to run the Looking For Group Roleplaying Game is in the box:
-- Easy-to-understand rules for beginners, hilarious and bizarre rules and examples to delight veteran gamers;
-- A replayable sample adventure, Tojen, Crosh, Haima, and Juju Are Dead, taking place before the events of the now-classic Looking for Group page 133, in which our heroes must stop a Legion plot to destroy a dam, flood a temple, and push the civil war in the North past the tipping point. 2+ hours of play time;
-- A set of RPG dice and an LFG dice bag;
-- Pre-generated characters of the cast of Looking For Group, Richard, Cale (with Sooba), Benny, Krunch, and Pella, as well as a blank character sheet;
-- Over 50 pawns and a double-sided, dry-erasable mat to play out your LFG adventures;

Like the comic it’s based on, the Looking For Group Roleplaying Game includes rules based on iconic fantasy imagery and popular gaming tropes, as well as the action and antics found on every page of Looking For Group! You’ll be able to:

-- Play as the cast of Looking For Group, Richard, Cale (with Sooba), Benny, Krunch, and Pella, or build your own character!

The LFG Roeplaying Game was designed by Ryan Costello, Jr, with more than 50 pieces of original art by Aurélie Martin and Lar DeSouza, and maps by d20 Monkey’s Brian Patterson. It includes:

-- Two new races (lifeless, based on Richard and the undead inhabitants of a little village up the coast, and taurine, based on Krunch and the other Bloodrage), and five cornerstone races (dwarf, elf, gnome, half-breed, and human);
--Six new archetypes:
- War maestro, a bard that likes the feel of both weapons and instruments;
- Healer, a cleric as adept at healing the living as un-healing the undead;
- Soldier, any decent army’s disciplined ranks of fighters;
- Weapon monk, a philosophical warrior whose fists are hardened weapons and whose weapons are hardened weapons;
- Righteous ranger, a free spirited warrior who believes in good above all;
- Warlock, a powerful sorcerer who believes in fwoosh above all.

-- 22 new feats, (like Cruel Fuel, which allows spontaneous casters to regain spells by killing innocent, ineffective creatures, and Griefer, where your effectiveness in combat improves based on the bad things that happen to your “allies”) and dozens of cornerstone feats, enough to make any character you want;
-- 20 new spells (like babality, the curse of youth, and shed flesh, the ability to animate the skeletons of the living) and a full catalogue of cornerstone spells or utility and destruction;

168917.description:
Think only pirates, time travelers, vampires and bears can smash bases? Well, get ready to be taught a lesson — in the nicest way possible!

Pretty Pretty Smash Up brings the sweetest factions ever to the vicious fight for victory! Kitty Cats use their incredible cuteness to take control of enemy minions. Princesses ply their royalty, beauty and even their love to get their way. Fairies' fickle tricks give you options like never before, while the herds of Mythic Horses work together for dominance. Get ready — your opponents will never know what hit them!

Pretty Pretty Smash Up can be played on its own as a two-player game or combined with other Smash Up titles to allow for up to four players to compete at the same time.

Integrates with:


Smash Up

The Good, The Board and the Passed to the Left: Episode 21 “Drafting”
We Smash It All Up: Our Pretty, Pretty, Smash Up Review

168918.name: The Belongers
168918.description:
Once upon a time there were two villages--alike in every way-- nestled in a land surrounded by fog. It was obvious to each that the other did not belong...

The Belongers is a 2-player semi-abstract strategy game, played without a board, wherein each player tries to raze the opposing village to win.

The game is set up by arranging the hexagonal terrain tiles in one of the map configurations available in the rulebook (or a custom map created by the players).

On their turn, each player takes two of the three possible actions: draft a terrain tile to the map, draft a unit, or move and/or attack with a unit.

Additionally, each unit may use its special ability AND terrain bonus once per turn. Each of the units has a unique special ability, and each of the terrains offers a unique bonus...creating huge number of possible combinations for players to explore as they maneuver around the map, attack enemies (either directly, or by pushing them into hostile terrains), and finally, destroying the opposing castle.

A deep strategy war game that plays any small flat surface.

168919.name: Kuros
168919.description:
When Katya, a young explorer with no memory of her past, awakens on Kuros™, she finds a mysterious alien world teetering on the brink of destruction. Determined to piece together her forgotten life, she sets out to explore her strange surroundings. With the guidance of six unique allies, help Katya explore five elemental realms - Wood, Fire, Water, Metal, and Aether - and heal the mysterious glyphstones that govern the landscape. Collect quest-related hidden objects, construct useful items and power-ups, and solve puzzles to restore balance to this mystical world. Discover the mysteries of Kuros today!

Source: The Publisher Website.

168920.name: Dungeon World Missing Paths: Barbarian
168920.description:
From publisher blurb:

What is best in Life?

Civilization is a lie the weak hide behind. The world honors only strength, be it of blade or will. For you, there is anger, fury from behind your heart. Where you go, blood spills like water, and man and beast alike cower before you.

In the world behind the walls, they measure worth not by might, but by metal discs. So be it. These ‘dungeons’ offer a hunt worthy of you, worthy of your might. To live in the moment, to let red haze overtake you, to laugh at Death and call him friend; to do this is to truly live For you are The Barbarian!

Love the old feel, new rules of the award-winning Dungeon World, but reached the end of the book? Need a break from your long campaign with a one-shot but don’t want to give up the themes and character classes you love? Dungeon World Missing Paths adapts and reimagines your favorite classic and modern fantasy archetypes into the high-speed rules-lite Dungeon World system as a series of playbooks: standalone character classes streamlined enough that the entire class and its progression can fit on the character sheet.

168921.name: The Seventh Circle
168921.description:
From the publishers website:

You are the presenters and crew of a paranormal investigation television show. The show is building up to the end of its current season and has been presented with the opportunity to record an investigation on the remote Scottish island of Eilean Mòr. The island has a history of strange disappearances that stretches back over the last hundred years, but more recently a house was built there by a famous architect, Nathan Glaas, who went missing immediately after its completion. Even though no-one has entered the building in the last seven years, it is far from empty…

The Seventh Circle is a Fear Itself adventure for 4-6 players by Matthew Sanderson, author of The Love of Money. It is designed as a stand-alone adventure with pre-generated characters provided, but it can be tweaked to accommodate characters in a pre-existing group.

The Genius Guide to the Talented Ranger
